commit_message:
Remove project_id from alternate image link path

Removes the project id from the alternate link path
generated for the v3 API os-images extension.

Also fixes issue with os.path.join being used to generate
urls which will break on Windows.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Icc34359cc935920e2d4780849d9310c4961c8f74

The image file has been renamed but what the reader actually sees (the contents of the image) still refers to "Quantum" and quantum-dhcp-agent, etc.

Where is the image from, does someone have a source file for them or do they need to be completely redrawn? Also note that as per the review of the patch for the other guide this image is duplicated in the basic-install and openstack-network-connectivity-admin guide, probably should move to common and use the same file.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
LBaaS: add delete_health_monitor() to driver API

Currently there is create_health_monitor() in the driver API so
a driver may create an object on device but there is no delete_health_monitor()
and monitor objects will remain on device forever.
Driver should at least call plugin to delete a db object.

Fixes bug 1198996

Change-Id: Idcdaea0636e01381064983d8de5bfe3936357fb9

commit_message:
remove policy checks in port_security tests

This patch removes the unneeded policy checks in the port_security_tests
that are now done in the policy engine.

Fixes bug: 1203925

Change-Id: Iee8a2f4e8a8fdbb5e070b4bab78f7c6ba21daba1

it does matter in practice, otherwise the global requirements test fails.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-22 20:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMHO in this context the '-1' does not really meter, this kind of things becomes matters:
 - If you would like to distinguish the error type on the exit. 
 - You would like to use a caller script on multiple platform and make decision based on the exact exit code.

I just noted it on the IRC.

(usually >128  (64)error codes means killed by a signal in bash)

https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/shell.py#L493

I would really appreciate If you could add this kind of lines as well:
if __name__ == "__main__":

They usually helpful in a basic python interactive debug.
Ie.: nothing executes on module import (may be this will also solve one of the one of the flake8 exception)'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2013-07-23 17:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add exit codes if run_stress.py detects an error

This is just a very basic exit code handling. Could be later enhanced by
different exit codes.

Implements: blueprint stress-tests

Change-Id: Idcf55163614f69d81fed538f7190bb63fe11dc2c

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi,
I would strongly advocate for this, since python-requests 1.2.3 is in Sid.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-07-19 15:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Dirk for referencing change Ifb59c0d5eb7fed48b01c67ec19dc79e79657fe2d

That takes a different approach and removes the max version completely. Why do we need the max version? What's special about version 1.2.4?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-20 07:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think the original reason for requests being limited to an older version was a regression. I think requests was more than once already cause of a regression, so thats why the version bumping is more cautious here than elsewhere.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-07-20 12:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dirk Mueller, please define what type of regression.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-22 08:02:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Re-reading the old commits, I think now that the reasons for the capping on requests were not related to requests itself but due to side-effects in gating and other bugs. I remember one API incompatibility that we had to patch, but that was before 1.0. 

so I'm fine with uncapping requests."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Bump requests to 1.2.3.

Ubuntu 13.10 ships requests, to include, 1.2.3, so make sure
we are instaling a newer version.

Change-Id: I8eb668d8320174c2986a95b33ea412b7c0ee010f
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix a few visual issues on the network topology diagram.

This commit separates CIDR labels with a comma and adjusts the vertical
positioning of port labels for improved readability.

Change-Id: I57510033fcc309b5d570d7ee6a9369a97775719b
Fixes: bug #1199086

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-29 13:58:11.000000000', 'message': "Return proper error message when network conflicts

Fixes bug 1158075
When creating a network which is already existing, we got
an internal server error which can't show the error reason.
This patch returns conflict error(HTTP 409) instead of
internal server error(HTTP 500), so that users can know
the error reason from the error message.

Change-Id: I9e39a7152e37756b34b1c8d77de057012743f0f7
(cherry picked from commit 8a80c4c0968a9deceaa6d99629c6d7f7889769e5)
"}]
commit_message:
Return proper error message when network conflicts

Fixes bug 1158075
When creating a network which is already existing, we got
an internal server error which can't show the error reason.
This patch returns conflict error(HTTP 409) instead of
internal server error(HTTP 500), so that users can know
the error reason from the error message.

Change-Id: I9e39a7152e37756b34b1c8d77de057012743f0f7
(cherry picked from commit 8a80c4c0968a9deceaa6d99629c6d7f7889769e5)

commit_message:
Cell Scheduler support for hypervisor versions

Adding the hypervisor version to cell capacities
Creating a filter in cell scheduler to filter cells based on
prominent hypervisor version

Partially Implements blueprint xen-support-for-hypervisor-versions

DocImpact: Adding a filter in cell scheduler to pick cells based on
the hypervisor version required by the image. The image can have
metadata called hypervisor_version_requires which will be matched
against the cell's prominent hypervisor version.
The prominent_hypervisor_version is stored in nova.conf under cell
capabilities.

Change-Id: Ied716a5964fd86a919ffb8bac99100afb770896e

[{'created': '2013-07-19 23:09:19.000000000', 'message': "Add create & attach times to SolidFire attributes.

This change simply adds create_time and attach_time to
the SolidFire devices attributes.

Times are taken from the volume-ref object, attach_time
is only set/present after an attach, and is also removed
from the attributes list on a detach.

This also required that we actually set attach_time on the
volume in the db.  We have the column, but we weren't actually
setting it, so this change required that be fixed.

In the future we should also look at changing the attach_time
from a string to a proper date-time object.

Change-Id: Ib9577ac160596a6878d1729f6022885b6cfa90e2
"}, {'created': '2013-07-22 15:06:32.000000000', 'message': "Add create & attach times to SolidFire attributes.

the SolidFire devices attributes.

Times are taken from the volume-ref object, attach_time
is only set/present after an attach, and is also removed
from the attributes list on a detach.

This also required that we actually set attach_time on the
volume in the db.  We have the column, but we weren't actually
setting it, so this change required that be fixed.

In the future we should also look at changing the attach_time

Change-Id: Ib9577ac160596a6878d1729f6022885b6cfa90e2
"}]
commit_message:
Add create & attach times to SolidFire attributes.

This change simply adds create_time and attach_time to
the SolidFire devices attributes.

Times are taken from the volume-ref object, attach_time
is only set/present after an attach, and is also removed
from the attributes list on a detach.

This also required that we actually set attach_time on the
volume in the db.  We have the column, but we weren't actually
setting it, so this change required that be fixed.

In the future we should also look at changing the attach_time
from a string to a proper date-time object.

Change-Id: Ib9577ac160596a6878d1729f6022885b6cfa90e2

commit_message:
Put zmq, redis, mysql into requirements.txt

ZeroMQ, Redis, and MySQL dependencies were incorrectly
placed into test-requirements.txt. Move them!

I believe they were in here because they had C dependencies and
were optional for testing in an age before we used tox. Other
optional modules with C dependencies (such as Qpid) are in
the standard requirements.txt file.

Change-Id: Id0b033c91e78c74643f79a36607dccd34370dd6d

commit_message:
Unpinning upper bound on python-*clients

If any of the projects specify a capped client, it has the
potential for preventing that client from being tested in the
gate. To fix this, maximum versions are uncapped for all
openstack client code in all openstack projects.

python-neutronclient is treated as an exception for now.

Fixes: bug #1200214

Change-Id: I64c68db0632b6547a6340c952bdb9cafe11ea1d9

[{'created': '2013-07-20 01:54:23.000000000', 'message': "Add 'Z' into isoformat for UTC time

Based on this http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_zone_designators.
A isofomt of time need a 'Z' for UTC time zone, or none for local time zone

request on GET /<version>/<account>/<container>?format=json still output a
UTC time without 'Z'

fixes bug #1169287
Change-Id: Ib599b5ec8fd223878ec18df7c1ec8d952fc2630a
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'Z' into isoformat for UTC time

Based on this http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_zone_designators.
A isofomt of time need a 'Z' for UTC time zone, or none for local time zone

request on GET /<version>/<account>/<container>?format=json still output a
UTC time without 'Z'

fixes bug #1169287
Change-Id: Ib599b5ec8fd223878ec18df7c1ec8d952fc2630a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 16:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Always init cfg.CONF before running a test

In all tests cfg.CONF is not (re)initialised correctly
By chance in ceilometer , the only method that fail when conf is not
initialised is cfg.CONF.find_file.
And because some tests do special initialisation (ie: the ones that test
ceilometer.service.prepare_service stuff), the method cfg.CONF.find_file
works when we run all tests.

But if you decide to run only one test (like below) that use find_file it fail
because cfg.CONF is not initialised.

  tox -epy27,pep8 api.v2

Not all configurations opts are impacted but only the CLI opts ones that are
set only when cfg.CONF() is called.

This change initialise cfg.CONF on each test (but the test can
continue to reinitialise it if needed)

Change-Id: I37842e945a7e2908e17d5ce886e17047a36818f7
'}]
commit_message:
Always init cfg.CONF before running a test

In all tests cfg.CONF is not (re)initialised correctly
By chance in ceilometer , the only method that fail when conf is not
initialised is cfg.CONF.find_file.
And because some tests do special initialisation (ie: the ones that test
ceilometer.service.prepare_service stuff), the method cfg.CONF.find_file
works when we run all tests.

But if you decide to run only one test (like below) that use find_file it fail
because cfg.CONF is not initialised.

  tox -epy27,pep8 api.v2

Not all configurations opts are impacted but only the CLI opts ones that are
set only when cfg.CONF() is called.

This change initialise cfg.CONF on each test (but the test can
continue to reinitialise it if needed)

Change-Id: I37842e945a7e2908e17d5ce886e17047a36818f7

commit_message:
Remove extra pep8/flake8/pyflakes requirements

pep8 flake8 and pyflakes are pinned as part of hacking.  So they don't
need to be pinned here as well.

Also add posargs to flake8, so can do things like 'tox -epep8 --
--statistics'

Change-Id: Id37949caa5a487cd98b6b85c026689fbd63cb5d8

commit_message:
Fix the filtered characters list from console-log

In fffcaea1 ^M was added to the list of characters to filter from the
console-log output but, because of a typo in the regexp, the
character '-' was added to that list too and has been removed since
then.

Fixes bug #1194032

Change-Id: Ia02b0b4c7027cbd09a51042ca1b5d28890413626
(cherry picked from commit c651f4928c65407cff86a9f9efc046a0f76a9519)

commit_message:
Change volume manager to volume type, unset property for type

In the unset method in volume_type, it was calling the volume
manager, instead of the volume_type.

Bug: 1203561
Change-Id: Iea1a9214db90f15815a456955040c0c5a795ff3d

commit_message:
Clean up properties (metadata) formatting

* Reformat default dict output to key='value' using utils.format_dict()
* Changes utils.get_item_properties() to pass the specific field to
  the formatter function rather than the entire resource object, this
  allows the formatter to handle multiple attributes.
* Updates server, volume, volume type commands

Change-Id: I90eebf6b84ae200532f09cd925f371598ea54a64

commit_message:
HP 3PAR Doc changes for QOS feature

Added doc changes for the new QoS feature for the HP 3PAR
drivers, also removed the iSCSI tag on copy volume to image
and copy image to volume as the FC driver now supports it.

Change-Id: I151ada4c797ef980203fa665ab6b6942156351cf
Fixes: bug 1202779

commit_message:
Ensure url is a string for requests.post

requests.post doesn't support SplitResult object as url

This change ensure that the url passed to requests.port is a string

Change-Id: Ibfdd51f06edffc4ea744ff21cd53591c2db6e251

[{'created': '2013-07-23 00:58:29.000000000', 'message': "Update neutron_available config option.

Tempest change I5ee9ec816845de483fe88d76d1bb047e7bb1af7e changed
the behavior of the neutron_available config option. This commit
updates devstack to use it's new name and group.

Change-Id: I7d5074209fe81f6100f380512d7702fbc8e252ac
"}]
commit_message:
Update neutron_available config option.

Tempest change I5ee9ec816845de483fe88d76d1bb047e7bb1af7e changed
the behavior of the neutron_available config option. This commit
updates devstack to use it's new name and group.

Change-Id: I7d5074209fe81f6100f380512d7702fbc8e252ac

commit_message:
improving error handling in chunked upload

Keep traceback of chunked upload in a variable and raise it after
deleting orphaned data to avoid covering sys.exc_info().

fixed bug #1185609
fixed bug #1199125

Change-Id: If489f42bb97a01519d13de47eeb5d180b31ba6a7

Updating HACKING with some test writing recommendations

[{'created': '2013-07-17 22:05:09.000000000', 'message': "nvp plugin rxtx_factor readonly update port

The following change done in nova 7de916 started passing in the
rxtx_factor on update port rather than just on create_port which
is what we only originally supported. Therefore currently when
booting a vm and specifying --nic port-id it will fail to boot with:
Cannot update read-only attribute rxtx_factor. This patch is a work
around to allow the rxtx_factor value to be passed in on update port even
though we ignore the value. Later we'll implement updating rxtx_factor on
ports but this is a good work around for now.

Fixes bug: 1202406

Change-Id: Iedd488b7bdc9b1a1317000d249f03b0eafbea419
"}]
commit_message:
nvp plugin rxtx_factor readonly update port

The following change done in nova 7de916 started passing in the
rxtx_factor on update port rather than just on create_port which
is what we only originally supported. Therefore currently when
booting a vm and specifying --nic port-id it will fail to boot with:
Cannot update read-only attribute rxtx_factor. This patch is a work
around to allow the rxtx_factor value to be passed in on update port even
though we ignore the value. Later we'll implement updating rxtx_factor on
ports but this is a good work around for now.

Fixes bug: 1202406

Change-Id: Iedd488b7bdc9b1a1317000d249f03b0eafbea419

Refactoring unit tests for validation

Created utils.py for validation UT
Created common class for validation UT - ValidationTestCase
File test_validation.py was splitted to test files for each file in validation

Exception code cleanup

Remove old commented code
Remove some incorrect comments
Remove unnecessary __class__ indirection
Convert err.__str__() to str(err)
Remove unused tb item in test

Hi, sorry have to -1 again, the comments i posted in a previous PS were not addressed. Replies posted inline. Thank you,'}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-07-19 17:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-07-19 17:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Hi Ben, 

My main problem with the proposed changes was the use of __class__.msg_fmt which was inconsistent with all the other exception having self.msg_fmt. 

I see that you have moved those changes to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35117/5/nova/exception.py, but it seems like they belong in this PS too.

With those changes in here, I think that would be +1 for me.

Thanks,'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-07-19 17:36:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

I don't agree that the __class__ change belongs here.  This is the functional change to address the Exception.message shadowing.  The style changes (which is what removing __class__ is IMHO) are in the other change."}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:59:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Fair enough. I can see the justification of it being a style change for putting it in the other change set. 

The other concern I had was I see that ApiError's message field changed names, but I don't see that the corresponding update was made by any consumers of the ApiError exception. 

Also, if somebody catches it with Exception how do we know that they won't break trying to access error.message when they should really be calling error.api_message."}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:19:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Adding the -1 just so the ApiError question is addressed."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There may be changes needed when this gets synced to the other projects.  It's not the end of the world if something keeps looking at APIError.message though since they'll just get "code: message" instead of "message".  Once this gets merged to Oslo I will sync it across to the other projects and make sure they get the necessary updates.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-20 13:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute

Exception.message is deprecated in Python 3, and it's confusing
that we shadow it right now, so change class attributes named
message to something else.

For reference, see commit 7bfd4439fe48e861675e3930486b55f8badd072e

Change-Id: I913a8a5d025cc392ef2003951763cf55629fd8d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-12 18:14:40.000000000', 'message': 'python3: Add python3 compatibility support

Add python2/python3 compatibility support:

- Use six.iteritems() to replace dictionary.iteritems()
  on python2 or dictionary.items() on python3.

- Use six.advanced_iterator as a replacement to call
  it.next() on python2 and next(it) on python3.

Change-Id: I48442696b66392de33520714b9beb2c645ec1b58
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-07-15 17:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'python3: Add python3 compatibility support

Add python2/python3 compatibility support:

- Use six.iteritems() to replace dictionary.iteritems()
  on python2 or dictionary.items() on python3.

- Use six.advanced_iterator as a replacement to call
  it.next() on python2 and next(it) on python3.

Change-Id: I48442696b66392de33520714b9beb2c645ec1b58
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Add python3 compatibility support

Add python2/python3 compatibility support:

- Use six.iteritems() to replace dictionary.iteritems()
  on python2 or dictionary.items() on python3.

- Use six.advanced_iterator as a replacement to call
  it.next() on python2 and next(it) on python3.

Change-Id: I48442696b66392de33520714b9beb2c645ec1b58
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
fix broken link in heat cli-guide

In the current heat_client quickstart guide there is a link to the wordpress
templates that gets a 404 error. I have updated section_cli_heat.xml to reflect
https://github.com/openstack/heat-templates which is referenced as the proper
url in the bug description.

Change-Id: Ic23b6c4b11c35148ea3d386d3d6c22322eaefbcc
Fixes: bug #1203814

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-22 22:14:07.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Configure rabbit and EPMD to bind to an address"

Since this breaks people using rabbit in the standard way, I
rather revert this change, and fork my own ops-messaging cookbook
since this is intended as an example cookbook (granted others
may use it directly).  This code would be better off in my
own fork, where i do not impact others, with a non-merged upstream
rabbitmq feature.

This reverts commit 3b35ac204d7b117e86cc51d72bfc4a927183a92a.

Change-Id: I53da70583c50ae985d3842c3d709eb81f565d63d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Configure rabbit and EPMD to bind to an address"

Since this breaks people using rabbit in the standard way, I
rather revert this change, and fork my own ops-messaging cookbook
since this is intended as an example cookbook (granted others
may use it directly).  This code would be better off in my
own fork, where i do not impact others, with a non-merged upstream
rabbitmq feature.

This reverts commit 3b35ac204d7b117e86cc51d72bfc4a927183a92a.

Change-Id: I53da70583c50ae985d3842c3d709eb81f565d63d

If ceilometer has cloudwatch compatible api, then there are many tools
developed for aws cloudwatch can be used by ceilometer. It will save our
time to collect data and publish data.

Change-Id: I8a57d69e1665689a4b58ddef6785980b48bba8f7
'}]
commit_message:
CloudWatch API for Ceilometer

If ceilometer has cloudwatch compatible api, then there are many tools
developed for aws cloudwatch can be used by ceilometer. It will save our
time to collect data and publish data.

Change-Id: I8a57d69e1665689a4b58ddef6785980b48bba8f7

commit_message:
find_record should take a domain_id argument

This allows us to use domain['tenant_id'] rather than context.is_admin
for privilege checks.

Change-Id: Ic4724c2aed8a2bcaa3409998c7d23c5c3855f975

commit_message:
Add indexes to sqlite

Migration `133_folsom.py` do not create indexes for sqlite.
Added missed indexes with tests.

Fixes bug 1191838

Change-Id: I018e29ba46f2017241c13742169896625944194e

commit_message:
fix unit tests in 2.6 by using closing(GzipFile)

Python 2.6 doesn't support using GzipFile as a context manager.

Change-Id: Ic12b5a916bc89ae8d4480879723201c1715285af

Alex Xu,
Yes, The wrapped stdout is a candidate solution.
but I prefer to use "strutils.safe_encode(formatted)" instead of the wrapped stdout: 
1.We will have the hardcode of python version in wrapped stdout. ex:2.6
2. If we just implement the function write(self, string) in the wrapped stdout, then there will be traps, because the wrapped stdout is not a complete stdout.
3. Two ways to fix this issue: encode the "string" in the body of the function write(self, string), or make sure "string" is a safe string per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Encoding#Encoding_output. I prefer the latter one.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Fixes encoding output issues for python-quantumclient.

Use strutils.safe_encode() to make sure
the encoding output is safe.
example: stdout.write(strutils.safe_encode(formatted))

* As per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Encoding.

Fixes bug #1189112

Change-Id: Ia6f498b9a9b189404fe08cacf6ab09ad34e217e8

commit_message:
Refine regex that converts localip

The regex is converting 0.0.0.0 to the hosts localip, in most cases this
would be ok but on the overcloud in the metadata we have "ovs_range":
"10.0.0.0/8" which was getting converted to 1192.0.2.5/8.

Change-Id: If97107556a5b5de7c33049b6a798cc80b75b0cb8

commit_message:
Use assignment_api rather than assignment

When normal dependency injection is used the variables
are named like "xxx_api".
This change makes it so that the identity backend and
drivers use "assignment_api" rather than "assignment"
so it will be easier to switch to normal dependency
injection.

Part of fix for bug 1200769

Change-Id: I7805b338c48d57ca1922bb622a3f474f2341f4ac

subject: Add strip_unit and strip_count to Rbd driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-23 05:45:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Stripping can be useful in certain IO pattern but not all. Therefore I doubt the value of having a global configuration for all volumes."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 06:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/52/38252/1/check/gate-cinder-pep8/5229 : SUCCESS in 2m 08s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/52/38252/1/check/gate-cinder-docs/5123/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 15s

- http://logs.openstack.org/52/38252/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-testr-full/1019 : FAILURE in 30m 57s (non-voting)

- http://logs.openstack.org/52/38252/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/20329 : SUCCESS in 22m 39s
"}, {'account_id': 7593, 'date': '2013-07-23 07:14:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Zhiteng: But it's afflictive that I can't change it. In one user case, I have two storage backend and I want to use ceph backend as a special way. So I need the arguments exported to change"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-23 07:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Haomai, you _can_ always enable stripping even on per volume basis. Having a global configuration option, and using it as an interface to turn on/off some feature may only benefit few volumes, IMHO, is the wrong direction.

Cinder has more flexible framework to support these kind of requirement, why not take a look at volume types?'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-07-23 07:48:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I agree it's useful to make striping choices more granular.
Winston, do you think extra_specs would be the right place for striping information?

It'd be great to implement the striping parameters in every place the rbd driver creates an image - create() is the main one, but there's also clone() (which is a full copy) and _clone(). You'll see there's no striping arguments to clone in the librbd python bindings, but since ceph 0.61.3, there are a set of ceph options that change the default image creation parameters. If you don't pass stripe unit and count and features to librbd's clone or create, these default settings take over. So you can set these default settings without passing the parameters to the functions,
and you don't have to worry about the python bindings not accepting stripe_unit for clone. They also affect copy, which also doesn't have striping parameters in librbd's python bindings.

These parameters are listed at:

https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/4ad13c945fd29a2d183f7ea6c6ac8a51d24dabe1"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-23 08:00:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Josh, yes, extra_specs is the right place to do such customization, that's exactly what I was talking about - use volume types."}, {'account_id': 7593, 'date': '2013-07-23 08:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Zhiteng, Josh:
Thanks, I got it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 05:20:05.000000000', 'message': "Add strip_unit and strip_count to Rbd driver

According to my tests, 'strip_count' and 'strip_unit' are critical arguments to
improve rbd performance.

So I want to add these two arguments to Rbd driver to let users adjust. The two
arguments are also implemented in Ceph backup driver.

Change-Id: I0564a0e84fc48d537cf2cc55358d9656e8e47f80
"}]
commit_message:
Add strip_unit and strip_count to Rbd driver

According to my tests, 'strip_count' and 'strip_unit' are critical arguments to
improve rbd performance.

So I want to add these two arguments to Rbd driver to let users adjust. The two
arguments are also implemented in Ceph backup driver.

Change-Id: I0564a0e84fc48d537cf2cc55358d9656e8e47f80

commit_message:
Move neutron_available option to service_available

This commit moves the neutron_available config option from the
network group to under the service_available group. The option
is also renamed to neutron.

Change-Id: I5ee9ec816845de483fe88d76d1bb047e7bb1af7e

commit_message:
Missed message -> msg_fmt conversion

We recently changed NovaException's to define `msg_fmt` instead of `message`
on the class. Looks like this exception was missed for some reason.

Fixes bug 1202255

Change-Id: If828bf42fa077665d1d92e08758fbddd342ab626

subject: Fix inconsistency between Nova-Net and Neutron

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-29 01:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Sorry but I don't like the approach here of mapping *any* quantum exception to NotFound just because that is the case that led to the original bug - we should be making the Quantum client raise more specific exceptions"}, {'account_id': 7781, 'date': '2013-07-01 08:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

My patch do not map *any* quantum client exception to NotFound :   If some other quantum error occurs, the status-code of this error will not be 404, thus the exception will be re-raised and treaded as before (my patch do not change this)

But I agree with you that the exceptions coming from QuantumClient must be more specific.  To do so we must not only modify the quantum client, but also quantum server that must enrich his error messages with supplemental data. This way quantum client will be able to translate errors coming from server in more specific exceptions (quantumclient/v2_0/client.py  method exception_handler_v20) .  But this major modification it is not the purpose of this patch and maybe its a good idea to fill a new bug report concerning all generic QuantumClientExceptions .'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-14 14:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

AFAIK the quantum/neutron and any openstack service expected to send 404 only in two condition:
- It is really not found, it does not exists. The resource already deleted or never existed.
- The resource is hidden because of the tenant isolation.

If the issue is more serious the quantum/neutron is the one who expected to log  the details.

I guess forewarning the original 404 entity body as response can be ok, if it has the same or similar format as the nova 404.

The current code (500) , can not be accepted by the tempest, because the 500 means the service has a serious issue, and you need to call for the admin or support immediately.

IMHO 5xx issues should be fixed ASAP.'}, {'account_id': 7781, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 7781, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7781, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Fix inconsistency between Nova-Net and Neutron

The neutron client raises NeutronClientException (status_code 404)
that is not unknown for nova, and is translated in 500 computeFault.
Catching this exception in nova/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py and
raising more generic exception as exception.NotFound solves the problem.

Added also an unitary test to test neutronv2 api

bug #1160309
bug #1200175

Change-Id: Ib2f1a0d49a12114b28f0cd5ce0bb7119f864d1a6

commit_message:
Sync sample config file generator with Oslo

The sample generator tool in Oslo is located in tools/config therefore
this patch moves the files in tools/conf to tools/config. The reason
Oslo chose 'config' is because the generator.py module is located in
the openstack.common.config package and update.py looks for the
corresponding directory in tools when it syncs the 'config' package.

./update.sh --module config --base nova --dest-dir $NOVA_HOME --nodep

Since every thing moved to tools/config, changes had to happen on
the tox.ini file and check_update.sh

Change-Id: Icbd467888cc7f16fa3694ed2b93548d0285461b5

subject: Fix oslo.config version generation
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-13 19:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36953/1/check/gate-oslo.config-pep8/216 : SUCCESS in 38s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36953/1/check/gate-oslo.config-docs/216/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 46s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36953/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python26/217 : SUCCESS in 1m 04s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36953/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python27/216 : SUCCESS in 45s
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-15 06:19:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I guess the version in setup.cfg is really there for the period after 1.1.0 was released and the work we were doing was doing to end up in 1.2.0 rather than 1.1.1 ... pbr can't figure that out for itself

So, yeah - we could remove this ... but then I'm likely to forget to bump it to 1.3.0 after 1.2.0 is released

Also, when i *do* bump it to 1.3.0, I'll do a bunch of commits and the version will go to e.g. 1.3.0a8.gabcedf and then I'll tag 1.3.0.a1

i.e. the version that pbr generates is fundamentally incompatible. Removing the version from setup.cfg really just defers the issue

Just looking at http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0386/#the-new-versioning-algorithm I reckon it would be more correct to do:

  1.2.0.dev2.g4f44b97

i.e. if you build from git, it's a pre-release not an alpha-release"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-23 06:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-23 06:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-24 14:15:57.000000000', 'message': 'Check of equal models and migrations.

We have a lot of problems with sync models and migrations today.
Changes in this structures can be differences and there are no tests
for determination this problem.

This test checking equality of models and state of migrations.
Object for check:
- set of columns
	here type, limit of length, default value, unique and nullable params will be checked,
- ForeignKeyConstraint
- UniqueKeyConstraint
- indexes.

Not merge this change while patches of sync models and migrations are not merged!
During this work few extra tables in db after migrations was found.

I will fix this bug later.

Change-Id: Ic142932ed92259b80518ebe695a53ee44bb8e4f0

commit_message:
Check of equal models and migrations (mysql).

We have a lot of problems with sync models and migrations today.
Changes in this structures can be differences and there are no tests
for determination this problem.

This test checking equality of models and state of migrations.
Object for check:
- set of columns
here type, limit of length, default value, unique and nullable params will be checked,
- ForeignKeyConstraint
- UniqueKeyConstraint
- indexes.

This test covers only mysql dialect.

Not merge this change while patches of sync models and migrations are not merged!
During this work few extra tables in db after migrations was found.

I will fix this bug later.

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations
Change-Id: Ic142932ed92259b80518ebe695a53ee44bb8e4f0

subject: Replace deprecated assertEquals with assertEqual

commit_message:
Replace deprecated assertEquals with assertEqual

assertEquals is deprecated as of python 2.7. Change the codebase to
use the non-deprecated alias.

Change-Id: Idf89daa0498849d64eaac6d28c1d6d6f40e248c7

commit_message:
WIP Refactor run_instance/spawn

Break down scheduling and building instances into steps to allow for
fine grained retry logic of different steps.  Sets up the use of
an orchestration library at a later time.

Very rough right now, just laying a foundation

part of bp query-scheduler

Change-Id: I52406d2ce32b26ef67737e908415b06e3cc0ad87

commit_message:
Add 405 response with allowed methods list

With this change we're able to give a proper response when a request is done
against an api entry point with a invalid method.
So now if you try, for instance, a DELETE against /servers you will get 405
response, NotAllowedMethod and a list of valid methods against that same entry
point.

Implements bp v3-api-return-allowed-methods

Change-Id: Icb7b4422cad72ede3501b81ef87702c2ffba02c7

This change implements the framework for input validation middleware.
Actual validation of the data passing between the transport and
storage layers will be implemented in subsequent patches.  The
framework allows authors of validation routines to implement their
code in "Validator" classes (one each for Queues, Messages, and
Claims).  Any methods with the same name as the underlying
controller will execute prior to the original logic.  The expectation
is that the validating routine will throw if a validation fails.

Change-Id: I655d52b4c92b6b0e40b158c2b7810c311ec3aaaa
Implements: blueprint input-validation
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a framework for input-validation

This change implements the framework for input validation middleware.
Actual validation of the data passing between the transport and
storage layers will be implemented in subsequent patches.  The
framework allows authors of validation routines to implement their
code in "Validator" classes (one each for Queues, Messages, and
Claims).  Any methods with the same name as the underlying
controller will execute prior to the original logic.  The expectation
is that the validating routine will throw if a validation fails.

Change-Id: I655d52b4c92b6b0e40b158c2b7810c311ec3aaaa
Implements: blueprint input-validation

commit_message:
Invalid entries in OVS flow table using GRE Tunnels

The VM can't ping outer network because
The MAC addresses in the flows are wrong and don't match the
ones displayed by ifconfig or the ones shown in Wireshark.

Fixes bug #1154383

Change-Id: Iaf3d062a7969653a922e30adee7a9c68fb751075

commit_message:
Keystone reports internal error when policy.json is broken

Need to provide an enhanced message to client of what had happened to
let user have enough information

Change-Id: I2c3ef3acf6520a964244ab66548fafb3cacc7c2e
Fixes: Bug 1177623

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 16:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8/5841 : SUCCESS in 2m 02s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-keystone-docs/4214/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 00s

- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-keystone-python27/4747 : SUCCESS in 7m 12s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/25817 : SUCCESS in 54m 45s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/25523 : SUCCESS in 57m 05s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/33422 : SUCCESS in 23m 41s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/12475 : FAILURE in 24m 58s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-06-25 06:52:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

I don't think this is a good idea.

There is no support for basic auth in any of the cli. This seems to suggest that you should be setting up basic auth when you put keystone behind apache. 

There are also other ways to do this including reverse proxying the connection.

I think the concepts and some snippets like the POST thing should be documented but in a way that people with some familiarity with apache will understand rather than something people will follow blindly. Doing remote user authentication will have consequences on everything and should be explained in a way that makes it clear that these are special cases. If you're not sure you need this then you really don't ..."}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-06-25 07:24:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This commit is misleading to any operator deploying keystone behind Apache. It suggests that the described authentication (Basic) is *needed* for keystone to work under apache, and it is not.

If you want to add such a documentation, add it in external-auth.rst"}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-06-25 07:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:22:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Responded to reviews and pushed up new patch.'}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:33:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Same comments apply to this patchset.

Keystone can run fine as an Apache WSGI app with the description and configuration that already exists. This change is misleading, since it suggests that basic auth is mandatory when running Keystone as a WSGI app, when it is not needed and even worse, it is not supported by the CLI.

This is more related to the external and REMOTE_USER authentication, so I'd better add this to external-auth.rst"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the response, do you want me to move it over to that .rst?'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-06-25 12:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-25 13:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/3/check/gate-keystone-pep8/5859 : SUCCESS in 1m 32s

- http://logs.openstack.org/34226/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/12664 : FAILURE in 20m 41s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-06-26 02:11:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I still think this is too direct. Basic auth is one type of external auth you may want to set up (though i can't imagine why) and this reads like you should be following this method to setup authentication. 

Its good to document what paths should be protected to use external auth, but then use basic auth as an example mechanism. It's not a common or supported deployment that we should be advising."}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-06-26 07:21:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd better not put this doc snippet where you placed it in the file. If I am somebody reading the documentation, it seems that it is mandatory to perform these steps. I'd rather put this documentation in a separate section, stating clear that it is an example that does not work with the current CLIs.

Moreover, the example is not really useful: setting just one user with htpasswd does not seem too logical or useful. Can you motivate the inclusion of this documentation?"}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-06-27 19:54:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Cisco plugin check for a valid nexus driver

The Cisco plugin model should check for a valid Nexus driver before performing any
operations on hardware nexus devices.

Change-Id: Ib7760cc7bb24e2c7f6692cbd8274aefa71dc21a1
Fixes: Bug #1202822

subject: E125 validation
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 08:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36788/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/4087 : SUCCESS in 1m 31s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36788/1/check/gate-tempest-docs/636 : SUCCESS in 1m 40s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36788/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/31533 : SUCCESS in 44m 01s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36788/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31226 : SUCCESS in 55m 50s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36788/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/2880 : FAILURE in 21m 41s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36788/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/84 : FAILURE in 49m 09s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-13 16:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-15 14:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:14:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I really hate E125, as it is overreaches - https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/issues/126

It is also incompatible with python-el in emacs, which means hand indenting. Please lets leave this off."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-15 20:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Attila, do you feel strongly we should do this or were you just trying to take an exception off the list? Matt and Sean, please agree. I don't have a strong opinion. I generally think pep8 is nitpicky but the indented way is a little more readable if the "if" body is long.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-15 21:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In general, I prefer to be err on the side of being too strict  with pep8, as otherwise reviews devolve into nit picking.  And if we have issues with E125, we should (and are) getting them resolved upstream, which will trickle downstream to us.

But IMHO as long as its upstream its fair game to gate on.  That being said tempest is a little smaller then nova so I see more leeway here.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-16 12:21:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

jog0 just because a random dude decided to implement E125 in pep that was an overreach of what the rule intended (and was called out on it and admits it), doesn't mean we gate on it.

We aren't niggling over E125 in the tree, so not enforcing it doesn't have a review cost."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-16 12:37:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Sean. In my 25+ years in development of various sorts, this environment is the most nitpicky with reviews I have seen. It is also the only one that has enforced pep8 or anything like it.  Another way to deal with nitpickyness is for us to just be less nitpicky."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-16 13:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

my bigger issue is assuming that the python pep8 project is the law. From my pov I've got 2 implementations of pep8 on my computer, python-el and pep8. (In emacs when I hit tab the line indents correctly according to pep8 rules.) In almost all places they agree. However on E125 (and one other E12 rule, the one about the indent on closing parens) they disagree.

It becomes even worse in that you can't actually use the tab key to get a valid indent for E125, you have to resort to manual spaces. And if you try to use any of the rope refactoring tools, that all gets scattered again. So there are real, practical reasons for not enforcing E125.

For 2 tools to implement 98% the same rules the same way, but disagree on a couple, makes me suspect of those rules, and makes me want to keep them turned off so I don't have to fight against my pep8 toolchain."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-16 15:30:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

David,

AFAIK OpenStack is the largest Open Source python project, as measured by number of active developers (note: if you know of anything bigger please let me know as I am unable to find good numbers ranking projects). To work at this scale we end up having to do things a little different then other projects.  Having a strict style guide does two things
* Make all the code look the same -- besides being 'pythonic'  this makes it easy for everyone to read everyone else's code
* By strictly enforcing style, we move the burden from the reviewer onto the developer, and we are currently reviewer limited not developer limited.

Early on OpenStack didn't even enforce pep8 and it was a mess, I cannot image going back to that.


Sean,

You make a good point -- tools fighting each other is bad.  If you don't want to enforce E125 until the issue is resolved lets add a comment to .tox saying so. So we don't have to have this conversation again.    

It looks like this bug was filed because someone blindly ran pep8 on tempest and saw E125 failed, if there was an explicit comment saying why E125 was ignored, this patch wouldn't be here today."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-16 18:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dkranz: I personally do not like many many enforced rules.

I just want to avoid any change rejected on review by a human just because of a style issue.

How to solve this ?'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-16 18:22:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

afazekas: There is no way to prevent this mechanically. Jog is right that something like pep8 is needed. Sean is right that we don't need some random contributor dictating to us. I think we should just accept pep8 as it is now, with our exceptions, and all try to be a little less picky. Resubmitting changes takes valuable time. 

The real headache of reading OpenStack code is that you never know what types the variables are, not minor style issues. Perhaps some people in the community have never used a language where a reader can know the types of all variables, point and click to a definition, get a static call chain by clicking, etc. There are a lot of nice things about python but being able to read and digest large amounts of code is not one of them."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-16 18:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

afazekas, I think the answer, in this case, is to wait until E125 is fixed upstream.  tempest already follows every other pep8 rule, a feat nova is far from reaching.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-18 20:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can we document in HACKING.rst the E125 is WONTFIX ?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-18 21:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We should mark E125 as a won't fix in tox.ini since that is where the ignore is listed"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-23 05:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This bug considered as a wont fix now.'}]

commit_message:
E125 validation

Tempest among the default pep8 rules just violates,
 the E125 in the boto tests (4 times).

Just with a minimal change tempest
 can pass on all default pep8 checks.

Fixing bug 1199262

Change-Id: Iaf782831372ba4e94ea0329675923b822077afa5

"}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-06-22 07:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Overall I'm not quite convinced to have a separate column to save the private key. People talked about adding an additional column to store arbitrary JSON data during the last meeting, and that may be a better choice. 

But even though, putting private keys into database is still a last resort - (the decryption is trivial - the key is just in the conf file). User credentials are stored in database for HA and Scaling operations. But the private keys would give people direct access to instances.

Have you further considered Steven's suggestion - "cfn-init to retrieve the instance metadata directly from heat"? It seems we can still start with a standard image by ssh into the system during instance creation time and setup whatever we need there.'}, {'account_id': 7395, 'date': '2013-06-24 15:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-06-24 17:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (7 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-06-24 18:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-06-24 18:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (13 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-25 18:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Liang Chen: Regarding "User credentials are stored in database for HA and Scaling operations. But the private keys would give people direct access to instances." 

While I also have heartburn over storing these sorts of things, this key is actually less of an issue than the user credentials. While the key would give someone access to a limited number of resources, the credentials give someone access to *every* resource the tenant has including the account itself. In my mind, this makes the credentials a much bigger risk overall, so storing key doesn't add appreciably to that risk.'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-06-25 19:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-25 20:11:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

Steve Baker,

I've broken out the resource private key change into its own review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35500/

Everyone,

When I run my tests with the entire test suite by running "tox", I see the same errors that Jenkins complains of.  However, when I run it the Cloud Server tests using one of the following methods, all tests pass:

tox -- heat.tests.test_rackspace_cloud_server
testr run heat.tests.test_rackspace_cloud_server
python -m testtools.run heat.tests.test_rackspace_cloud_server

Does anybody know why the cloud_server tests would fail when tox runs the entire test suite?'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-07-03 17:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

[{'created': '2013-07-12 08:58:13.000000000', 'message': "Refactor SSHPool.get() with Pool.get()

In previous code of SSHPool.get(), we pasted the code
from Pool.get() and check if a connection is active before return
it.

However, it's much simpler and cleaner to just call the Pool.get()
and then check the connection before return. With this,we can free
from manually keeping up with code of Pool.get() in upstream package
eventlet

as a side effect, this patch fixed bug #1194393 due to the bug in
eventlet code before revision 1072(and also previous code in utils.py)

Change-Id: Ic2bf2fa1ad82cf8669b6c491c955dcab39eb1510
"}, {'created': '2013-07-12 15:33:57.000000000', 'message': "Refactor SSHPool.get() to use Pool.get()

In previous code of SSHPool.get(), we pasted the code
from Pool.get() and check if a connection is active before return
it.

However, it's much simpler and cleaner to just call the Pool.get()
and then check the connection before return. With this,we can free
ourselves from manually keeping up with code of Pool.get() in
upstream package eventlet

As a side effect,this patch fixed bug #1194393 which caused by a
previous bug in eventlet codes before revision 1072

fixed bug #1194393
Change-Id: Ic2bf2fa1ad82cf8669b6c491c955dcab39eb1510
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor SSHPool.get() to use Pool.get()

In previous code of SSHPool.get(), we pasted the code
from Pool.get() and check if a connection is active before return
it.

However, it's much simpler and cleaner to just call the Pool.get()
and then check the connection before return. With this,we can free
ourselves from manually keeping up with code of Pool.get() in
upstream package eventlet

As a side effect,this patch fixed bug #1194393 which caused by a
previous bug in eventlet codes before revision 1072

fixed bug #1194393
Change-Id: Ic2bf2fa1ad82cf8669b6c491c955dcab39eb1510

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 06:52:51.000000000', 'message': "Load app before loading legacy client in tests.

When you load an old version of keystoneclient doing legacy tests and
then start the test app the ec2 work that depends on keystoneclient sees
the recently loaded legacy one which doesn't have the required modules
in it.

If we load the app first the ec2 modules are resolved and finds the
original keystone client. The ec2 module then uses
'from keystoneclient.contrib.ec2 import utils as ec2_utils' so the
ec2_utils reference is kept in the file scope so isn't affected by the
tests changing keystoneclient.

It is not a long term fix for bug 1178532 but it solves the immediate
symptoms when running client tests independently.

Change-Id: I7267ca0d4740f037884fae95f8a6562ee86584b9
"}, {'created': '2013-07-18 23:51:57.000000000', 'message': "Load app before loading legacy client in tests.

When you load an old version of keystoneclient doing legacy tests and

in it.

If we load the app first the ec2 modules are resolved and finds the
original keystone client. The ec2 module then uses
'from keystoneclient.contrib.ec2 import utils as ec2_utils' so the
ec2_utils reference is kept in the file scope so isn't affected by the
tests changing keystoneclient.

It is not a long term fix for bug 1178532 but it solves the immediate
symptoms when running client tests independently.

Change-Id: I7267ca0d4740f037884fae95f8a6562ee86584b9
"}]
commit_message:
Load app before loading legacy client in tests.

When you load an old version of keystoneclient doing legacy tests and
then start the test app the ec2 work that depends on keystoneclient sees
the recently loaded legacy one which doesn't have the required modules
in it.

If we load the app first the ec2 modules are resolved and finds the
original keystone client. The ec2 module then uses
'from keystoneclient.contrib.ec2 import utils as ec2_utils' so the
ec2_utils reference is kept in the file scope so isn't affected by the
tests changing keystoneclient.

It is not a long term fix for bug 1178532 but it solves the immediate
symptoms when running client tests independently.

Change-Id: I7267ca0d4740f037884fae95f8a6562ee86584b9

This is setting plaintext config options - an equivalent would be the quantum_config_api type - and I don't think the other native types that extend inifile are hiding what they set from the log to protect passwords.

If this is something we're actually worried about I could go through and change all the others in another patch, but since the passwords are all in the api-paste.ini files for each project in plain text I figured we weren't too concerned about them being in the puppet log.

[{'created': '2013-07-23 02:59:16.000000000', 'message': 'Support Cisco quantum plugin (WORKINPROGRESS)

This patch adds native types for the config files
needed to enable the cisco quantum plugin as well
as a class that will create these config files.

Users will be able to select their plugin
of choice by setting the core_plugin on the
openstack::controller, which will then create
the quantum::plugins::cisco class.

Change-Id: I8c131ebdbab149f589c84e52be8f810e39624941

commit_message:
Support Cisco quantum plugin

This patch adds native types for the config files
needed to enable the cisco quantum plugin as well
as a class that will create these config files.

Users will be able to select their plugin
of choice by setting the core_plugin on the
openstack::controller, and then creating
the quantum::plugins::cisco class separately.

Change-Id: I8c131ebdbab149f589c84e52be8f810e39624941

commit_message:
Add support for NetApp direct drivers

netapp_wsdl_url is only valid for the regular drivers.
netapp_storage_service is optional for all NetApp drivers.
See here for example:
http://docs.openstack.org/grizzly/openstack-block-storage/admin/content/netapp-iscsi-driver-direct-7mode.html

Change-Id: I8c6cd9d63b3e6da683bf210f1b4db7bd7fd3d315

counting garbage collectors (e.g. PyPy).

commit_message:
Ensure that files are always closed explicitly.

This is needed on Pythons without reference
counting garbage collectors (e.g. PyPy).

Change-Id: Ieb563ace9f65a4ad204b01be32bf7a9d5f226005

commit_message:
Implement dot in matching_metadata key for mongodb

Before the dict matching_metadata was stored as dict in mongo.
But mongo doesn't allow dot in dictionary key

This change converts the matching_metadata dict into a array like this:

[ { 'key': 'info.key.dotted', 'value': 'the_value'} ]

Fixes bug #1201886

Change-Id: Iab94c675749331ff7bfb0f74728dbd8f947f26f6

commit_message:
Implement a https:// in REST alarm notification

This change adds schemes https:// to the alarm notifier.

By default, the server certificate is verified like a browser does
but with the system CA.

A client certificate can be set in the configuration file.

 [alarm]
 rest_notifier_certificate_file = /path/certificate.pem
 rest_notifier_certificate_key = /path/private_key.pem

Change-Id: Id06e0a45ef88c15674052faeb941d87b70c7b99b
Blueprint: alarm-notifier

Nice work!

This needs a manual rebase as there has been some changes merged in the OVS agent recently which prevent this from merging cleaning.

Also, please add some notes to the commit message as I have indicated, because the problem being solved here wasn't clear to me until I re-read it a few times.

I did test this with devstack and it worked as advertised, however, and I like how it explicitly sets both IPs on tunnel endpoints."}, {'account_id': 7707, 'date': '2013-07-18 14:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-18 14:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': "GRE tunnels should include local_ip.

Because you may only specify one local IP for a quantum agent, and
your agents could be routed across different subnets (even for small
installations, for various reasons), it's important to also specify
the used local_ip when setting up the GRE tunnels. As long as the
address is routable on both ends, this will work. If the local_ip is
not specified, then traffic will mysteriously be dropped on one end
where the IP does not match the expected IP in the GRE tunnel.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1184696

Change-Id: I5d612bf9e4f6652af8b155cdd1748d73ac4539ff
Signed-off-by: Adin Scannell <adin@scannell.ca>

commit_message:
GRE tunnels should include local_ip.

This addresses the issue of having one or more multi-homed host.

Because you may only specify one local IP for a quantum agent, and
other hosts could be routed across different subnets (even for small
installations, for various reasons), it's important to also specify
the used local_ip when setting up the GRE tunnels. As long as the
address is routable on both ends, this will work. If the local_ip is
not specified, then traffic will mysteriously be dropped on one end
where the IP does not match the expected IP in the GRE tunnel.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1184696

Change-Id: I5d612bf9e4f6652af8b155cdd1748d73ac4539ff
Signed-off-by: Adin Scannell <adin@scannell.ca>

Sorry- there's still a problem. These functions are annoying and cause subtle problems.  The problem with what's there is that there is a bigger difference between sending in a path and letting the new env inherit it from the old. If you send in path=None into make_pre_authed_request and therefore also make_pre_authed_env that means that you clear out both the PATH_INFO and SCRIPT_NAME. So for that you need to let path=None when you make the sub-call to make_pre_authed_env.  But Request.blank needs a path so anyway here's what I think it should be (a diff applied to your patch #2):

http://paste.openstack.org/show/39775/

rebuilding the path looks a little weird (it drives me nuts that you're relying on PATH_INFO to begin with '/') but thats what's in the spec as far as I can tell:  http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0333/#url-reconstruction

anyway- i think thats right. yaaa for wsgi..."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-07-12 08:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-07-12 08:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Incorporated change as suggested by David Goetz. Added unit test to verify that both PATH_INFO and SCRIPT_NAME are copied from old env to new request.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 09:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:50:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm sorry- what i gave you wasn't any good either. I forgot how Request.blank works and didn't look through everything as I should have last time. With patch set 3 if you pass in an env like {'SCRIPT_NAME': '/hello'} and path=None you get r.path = '/hello/hello'.  Anyway- what I think now is you should just do this (from master):

http://paste.openstack.org/show/40232/

Pretty similar to your first patch :) Its confusing because when path is given to make_pre_auth_env it overrides env['PATH_INFO'] and clears out SCRIPT_NAME but Request.blank throws away the passed in path if the passed in env has PATH_INFO set and it doesn't reset SCRIPT_NAME, etc etc. Having some unit tests around all the weird edge cases would be great."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-07-15 13:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-07-15 13:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-07-15 13:58:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Fix make_pre_authed_request function to not fail when path arg is None.

The default value for the path arg to the function is None. However, if
the path arg is not set or is set to None an exception is generated when
the path value is passed to urllib.unquote(). The function doc states that
if path is not provided then the value in the env is used, so fix is to
implement this behaviour.

Change-Id: I085124acb6ef3cecb2375bb97d27996e0c6fd36e
Fixes: bug #1198149

- http://logs.openstack.org/29212/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/4781 : FAILURE in 9m 52s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-05-22 01:57:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm, but I haven't functionally tested with my DevStack Keystone yet, so only +1."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-22 20:11:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Code seems sane, but I don't have a Keystone instance around to run it on.

It's a little odd to me that a user can't delete his own account, but can delete every object and container therein. At that point, what good is the account? On the other hand, if the reseller admin is responsible for account creation, it makes sense to make them responsible for account deletion too.

I'm just not sure why we want to always forbid a user from deleting their account."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-22 20:24:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Well for first tempauth doesn't allow it and humm tempauth is sorta the reference implementation I guess.

I was asking to greg for confirmation and he was saying it doesn't make sense for him either.

most account system I know of does not allow users to delete themselves at least unix accounts, ldap etc..."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-22 20:39:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I can see it making sense in some cases, like if your company issues every employee their own Swift account for $reasons, and stuff gets confused if there's an employee without an account (because they deleted it).

I'm just not sufficiently sure of the reasoning to +2 this change, so I'm asking for more information. That's all. I'm currently neither for nor against it (though the code looks perfectly sane)."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-23 12:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

By the way, I will be happy to get you a login/password to a devstack with swift+keystone installed if that can make things easier to test this patch.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-05-24 22:32:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The main reason is because currently in swift deleting an account is consider an account administrator action.  When an account is deleted, it doesn't check to see if there are containers or objects, the reaper kicks in and deletes everything.  It is kind of a bummer when someone accidently issues the wrong command, and everything goes away."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-24 22:38:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Will this screw up bulk deletes? IIRC, those are done with an account-level DELETE that has some fancy query params."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-30 00:01:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Yep, definitely breaks bulk deletes.

Looks like to actually delete the account, you have to have an empty query string (see swift.proxy.account.controllers.AccountController.DELETE). That'd be a pretty easy check to add here, and then it wouldn't interfere with bulk deletes."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-30 07:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-30 08:05:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

My options?

buck is used to operate resources, so it must be authorised.

buck uses delete method for /container and /container/obj, so disallowing delete on account doesn't affect buck.

so, I prefer your set 3"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-06-07 07:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Don't allow users to delete their own account.

- In keystoneauth we allowed authenticated users to delete their own
  account we are disallowing that and only allow users with reseller
  admin to do that for its own or for the others.
- Fixes bug 1177526.

Change-Id: I825c5a968e8eae0991915056825fe0e0c195647e

Is there a reason why we need this?  The goal is actually banish and cross-drive calls within the actual backends - and instead make these calls from the manager level.'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2013-07-18 13:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Henry, agree but the assignment code is merged and I found "AttributeError: 'Identity' object has no attribute 'assignment'" error as I explained in the bug - https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1200769 

I believe Adam is/will be doing some rework on assignment but I thought of my code change as a temporary and quick fix to the bug. 

Thanks for your comment, as per my initial comment in that patch, I did want to get feedback for this fix to see if this makes any sense.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-07-19 23:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think this might be fixed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37962/'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

LDAP Identity backend should not be bound to the LDAP assignment driver. The reverses is OK:  LDAP assignment is only expected to work with LDAP identity'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2013-07-23 01:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

The bug is fixed under https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37962/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37821/'}]

Get assignment driver

Fixes Bug1200769

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 01:16:04.000000000', 'message': "Indicate kvs backend for tokens is only for testing

This backend is not usable in any production environment. All OpenStack
environments will already have a SQL DB, and if someone does not want to
use the DB they can use the memcache backend.

To explicitly show this backend shouldn't be used rename it to fake, as
that is what it is a fake backend for testing.

Fixes  bug 1188301 and bug 1188370

Change-Id: I41b147bcc70b79b4fc6df50b242a73cfcad33114
"}, {'created': '2013-06-27 18:52:19.000000000', 'message': "Indicate kvs backend for tokens is only for testing

This backend is not usable in any production environment. All OpenStack
environments will already have a SQL DB, and if someone does not want to
use the DB they can use the memcache backend.

To explicitly show this backend shouldn't be used rename it to fake, as
that is what it is a fake backend for testing. To preserve backwards
compatibility, make a new kvs driver that inherits the fake driver and
logs a warning saying it is deprecated.

Fixes bug 1188301 and bug 1188370

Change-Id: I41b147bcc70b79b4fc6df50b242a73cfcad33114

commit_message:
Deprecate kvs token backend

This backend is not usable in any production environment. All OpenStack
environments will already have a SQL DB, and if someone does not want to
use the DB they can use the memcache backend.

Fixes bug 1188301 and bug 1188370

DocImpact This backend should not be mentioned in documentation, as it
is not production grade and is deprecated.

Change-Id: I41b147bcc70b79b4fc6df50b242a73cfcad33114

commit_message:
Skip setting volume_size if not given

When the block-device parameters skip volume_size,
don't set it. Setting to an empty volume_size
would be invalid as it has to be an integer,
and Nova API will reject the request if api validation
is implemented. (proposed e.g. at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34749/)

Fixes bug LP #1199539

Change-Id: I7ab518886abf8d449caf1c70563a79a990d7765e

(1 inline comment)

I had one inline comment with accidental use of "blah" instead of r'blah' but I'm good with this. Thanks for the quick fix.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:21:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The RFC totally says q has to be the first param, and it has to exist for there to be more params.  But IMO it's an okay place to be lenient with the spec.

The spec also allows for parameters without a value, while I don't think this code does.  Though I don't know if that's actually been used in the history of HTTP.

It'd be nice if you pulled the param parsing into its own function, or I probably will later, because something I'm working on could re-use it!"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Now I'm confused.

Accept is defined as: media-range [ accept-params ]

accept-params is defined as: ";" "q" "=" qvalue *( accept-extension )

Which means q=qvalue has to be present before any other extensions, right?  But there are examples in the RFC like "text/html;level=1".'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yeah, the media-type grammar has parameter* at the end of it, and parameter is defined in section 3.6 as

       parameter               = attribute "=" value
       attribute               = token
       value                   = token | quoted-string

so that's why you can have a whole bunch of k1=v1, k2=v2 in there both before and after the q.

You get this in section 14.1 too:

    Each media-range MAY be followed by one or more accept-params,
    beginning with the "q" parameter for indicating a relative quality
    factor. The first "q" parameter (if any) separates the media-range
    parameter(s) from the accept-params.

So I guess you can't have a media parameter named "q" or it screws everything up. They say it's due to "historical practice", which I think means "don't blame me; it was like that when I got here".

Anyhow, I think it's fine, the one thing I'm not sure of is how to handle multiple q params. I went with calling it invalid, but I think it might possibly be the case that the first q param is the quality, and a second one is an accept-extension and should be ignored... dunno.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:19:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ah yeah, I missed the parameter at the end of media-range.  What a weird way to define it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-18 23:54:51.000000000', 'message': 'Allow some valid Accept headers.

"Accept: application/xml; charset=UTF-8" is totally valid, and has an
implicit q (quality) value of 1.0, just the same as "Accept: text/xml"
does.

Also, you can say things like:
Accept: text/xml; charset=UTF-8; q=0.9; anglebrackets="are awesome"
with as many arbitrary extensions as you want.

See RFC 2616 sections 14.1 Accept and 2.2 Basic Rules for details.

Fixes bug 1202453.

Change-Id: I18e6d0ee3fd6f9d889275ee8335e711c729b7171
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 23:56:34.000000000', 'message': 'Accept valid Accept headers in swob.

"Accept: application/xml; charset=UTF-8" is totally valid, and has an
implicit q (quality) value of 1.0, just the same as "Accept: text/xml"

Also, you can say things like:
Accept: text/xml; charset=UTF-8; q=0.9; anglebrackets="are awesome"
with as many arbitrary extensions as you want.

See RFC 2616 sections 14.1 Accept and 2.2 Basic Rules for details.

Fixes bug 1202453.

Change-Id: I18e6d0ee3fd6f9d889275ee8335e711c729b7171
'}, {'created': '2013-07-19 18:24:46.000000000', 'message': 'Accept valid Accept headers in swob.

"Accept: application/xml; charset=UTF-8" is totally valid, and has an
implicit q (quality) value of 1.0, just the same as "Accept: text/xml"
does.

Also, you can say things like:
Accept: text/xml; charset=UTF-8; q=0.9; anglebrackets="are awesome"
with as many arbitrary extensions as you want.

See RFC 2616 sections 14.1 Accept and 2.2 Basic Rules for details.

Fixes bug 1202453.

Change-Id: I18e6d0ee3fd6f9d889275ee8335e711c729b7171
'}]
commit_message:
Accept valid Accept headers in swob.

"Accept: application/xml; charset=UTF-8" is totally valid, and has an
implicit q (quality) value of 1.0, just the same as "Accept: text/xml"
does.

Also, you can say things like:
Accept: text/xml; charset=UTF-8; q=0.9; anglebrackets="are awesome"
with as many arbitrary extensions as you want.

See RFC 2616 sections 14.1 Accept and 2.2 Basic Rules for details.

Fixes bug 1202453.

Change-Id: I18e6d0ee3fd6f9d889275ee8335e711c729b7171
