Rohit,

I see your point. Its better to get the quick stuff that out of the way first since if it fails we can avoid the long running download.

That being said, I don't know if its currently safe to setup networking before informing the hypervisor of the migration via the pre_live_migration call. Its safe in the libvirt+KVM/QEMU case, but the intent of the call is to ask the hypervisor to do anything necessary to prepare for a migration.

A change in ordering like that would require a lot more research and understanding of the other hypervisors."}, {'account_id': 6896, 'date': '2013-07-22 11:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

During live block migrations both pre_live_migration and
pre_block_migration check for the prescence of the instance on
the destination and create the instance dir if it doesn't exist.

As a result the call to pre_block_migration always fails as
pre_live_migration has already created the instance dir on the
destination.

Fixes bug: #1193359

During live block migrations both pre_live_migration and
pre_block_migration check for the presence of the instance on
the destination and create the instance dir if it doesn't exist.

As a result the call to pre_block_migration always fails as
pre_live_migration has already created the instance dir on the
destination.

As it turns out the pre_block_migration call is completely
unnecessary. The libvirt driver is the only driver that uses the
call and the work it does can easily be done in the existing
pre_live_migration call. In order to streamline things we
completely remove the pre_block_migration call from all
drivers. Additionally we update the function definition for
pre_live_migration to pass needed disk info down to the
virt drivers.

Fixes bug: #1193359

Change-Id: Id9dfe482db3471d6a1b9b6c7d59a5ddc48775d7f

commit_message:
Check instance on dest once during block migration

During live block migrations both pre_live_migration and
pre_block_migration check for the presence of the instance on
the destination and create the instance dir if it doesn't exist.

As a result the call to pre_block_migration always fails as
pre_live_migration has already created the instance dir on the
destination.

As it turns out the pre_block_migration call is completely
unnecessary. The libvirt driver is the only driver that uses the
call and the work it does can easily be done in the existing
pre_live_migration call. In order to streamline things we
completely remove the pre_block_migration call from all
drivers. Additionally we update the function definition for
pre_live_migration to pass needed disk info down to the
virt drivers.

Fixes bug: #1193359
Change-Id: Id9dfe482db3471d6a1b9b6c7d59a5ddc48775d7f

commit_message:
Move heat_available option to service_available

This commit moves the heat_available config option from the
orchestration group to under the service_available group. The option
is also renamed to heat.

Change-Id: I86c93331a53b5a7323afe27839338ffa1428015f

commit_message:
Add nova config option to service_available group

This commit adds a new config option, nova, to the service_available
config group. This option is used to specify whether nova is running
or not. It also add a skip to base compute api test class.

Change-Id: I658f70f259734e366cecce1c8e0409255351af87

commit_message:
Add swift config option to service_available group

This commit adds a new config option, swift, to the service_available
group. This option can be used to specify whether swift is running.
It also adds a skip to the base object test class, replacing the
endpoint detection skip.

Change-Id: I8d81071cf5077fb880f04c04b330b1f4132a58f0

commit_message:
Add glance to service_available config group

This commit adds a new config option, glance, to the service_available
config group. This option is used to specify whether glance is running
or not. It also adds skips for the appropriate api tests.

Change-Id: I732b4d1d273bce4ba9d702bd3dbaae2bc5442e35

commit_message:
Add jeepyb to the list of cached repos

The pbr integration test turns out to also be a good test of the
contents of the requirements repo and of jeepyb's run-mirror script,
since it uses both. If we add jeepyb to the list of repos that are
on a devstack-gate node, then we can construct the integration test
to actually gate not only changes to pbr, but also changes to jeepyb
and requirements, which should ensure that we don't wind up with
bad requirements added or mirror breakages.

Change-Id: I8cea5f4df7563dcc7d44a046e2d3fb09e0d8fc9e

commit_message:
Refuse carriage return in header value

See bug #1188896.
Comparing with Curl and Django, they both refuse carriage returns in
header values, so the request() method on the HTTP(S)Connection instance
returned by swiftclient.client.http_connection() will raise an
InvalidHeadersException if any of the headers to be sent contain a
newline.

Drive-by fix for a couple of header values which were integers instead
of strings (Content-Length getting set to zero).

Fixes bug #1188896

Change-Id: Ic6afdb92882284f843aacb06d20f682ddcb47151

commit_message:
Allow use of hacking 0.6.0 and enable new checks

There are only several errors after running hacking 0.6.0:

* H501  Do not use locals() for string formatting
* H231  Python 3.x incompatible 'except x,y:' construct

Change-Id: Iacae482fda07507c3e7ce8e6da8dbb7bde699016

the script won't be able to finde the generator.py module. It will be
possible to run the generator anywhere if we add oslo's base dir to the
temporary python path.

commit_message:
Import config file generator module from python path

The sample config file generator will be executed in each project's
virtualenv after being copied using the update.py module. Therefore
accessing the generator module would not work the current way
of using relative paths. This patch executes the generator module
by directly importing it. The update.py will update the module path
when copying to each project.

Change-Id: Id40422ae170935d2fc1c7443eee4b31161b7d3d3

commit_message:
Fix issues syncing sample generator in update.py

When updating the openstack.common.config module, the shutil module
raises an exception when attemting to copy a directory.
Fixed to skip directories as copy targets and handle directories
of target module names.
Fixed problem of wrong import path of the generator module.

Change-Id: Ie8336b070573c74691ab5e7304dd05c540826c53

commit_message:
Add RPC methods for updating nodes.

By having the API service use an RPC call to the Conductor,
we can take an exclusive task lock on the node being updated.
This will prevent updates to a node while a task is in process on it.

This is the first method implemented using RPC of a versioned
object to provide distributed locking between API and Conductor
instances.

This patch also clarifies the description of node state changes
in states.py, and does a minimal amount of reasonable checking
to ensure that nodes do not get put into inconsistent situations.

It also adds some unit tests to the API for both the new method
and for get_all, which already existed.

Change-Id: I8364ef19bfe177d56ec7bc1c0f1e166125a20ec5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 21:17:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing broken credential schema in sqlite.

Credential table has foreign key constraint
referring to tenant table which is dropped.
Since sqlite does not support alter table
drop constraint, the foreign key constraint
was not dropped. When we try to load credential
table in sqlalchemy it fails because tenant
table does not exist. Fix is provided such that
the credential table is recreated without foriegn
key constraint and the data is moved from old
credential table to the new credential table.

Fixes Bug #1190383

Change-Id: I2946bfa6813d90feb634634e1b09c566ef58bef5

commit_message:
Fixing broken credential schema in sqlite.

Credential table has foreign key constraint
referring to tenant table which is dropped.
Since sqlite does not support alter table
drop constraint, the foreign key constraint
was not dropped. When we try to load credential
table using sqlite backend it fails because tenant
table does not exist. Fix is provided such that
the credential table is recreated without foriegn
key constraint and the data is moved from old
credential table to the new credential table.

Fixes Bug #1190383

Change-Id: I2946bfa6813d90feb634634e1b09c566ef58bef5

commit_message:
Sync requirements with OpenStack/requirements

Fixes proper casing of requirements
Allows usage of Hacking 0.6, which has a few
extra checks (Fix fallout).
Raises keystoneclient minimum requirement to
match those required by other projects.

Change-Id: I4604a62aa07e5026d219dc6e5b8b4c23b3caa3f1

Add eclipse project files to .gitignore

Like some of the other projects (nova, heat) ignore eclipse
project files, for those people that work with eclipse (yuck :)

Change-Id: Ifbb5762b6e16b315f4066ceff35e85d2ac6f990f

commit_message:
Fix up API tests before updating hacking checks.

The new hacking rules will enforce a license header check.
This patch updates a few recent files to clean up the header,
and remove an extraneous print function that snuck in.

Change-Id: Iab5e42d139d4414eb74b0ecc62710f0b23b882e4

commit_message:
Move _validate_int_value controller func to utils

This patch moves the _validate_int_value private method of the servers API
controller (intorduced in change
I18ac285d5b3c8200d7706c7d577809b15d6ab9e8) to utils, in order to make it
usable by code outside of the controller class. This method is very
general - it checks weather an input is a valid integer.

It also changes what exceptions it raises from HTTPBadRequest to
InvalidInput - all in the spirit of being more reusable.

Finally, it adds tests and fixes a small string formatting bug that was
uncovered by adding them.

Change-Id: I65f2b6474d572ed601d20dca9dda9936d306a219
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

commit_message:
Fixing the AJAX function location

This bug addresses the incorrect location of the AJAX function call in api.py and moves it to the correct location in views.py
It also standardizes the AJAX JSON function to use a generic Django class instead of a function.

Change-Id: I445ca58d1e05187c9d05fdb6814039c69543324c
Fixes: bug #1201980

Fix list formatting in docs

so it uses proper rst syntax and doesn't produce a
warning in the sphinx build.

Change-Id: I0d2adf36c7f5262770f5a3bda05c9ddd21efc17d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 16:13:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove references to clean arg from cache-manage

The usage message for glance-cache-manage lists "clean" as an available
command, but this functionality is part of a separate tool,
glance-cache-cleaner.

Remove any references to this to avoid confusion.

DocImpact
Fixes bug 1189451

Change-Id: I2aba8164ab9ef0c3bef31870cb3771233a722d27
'}]
commit_message:
Remove references to clean arg from cache-manage

The usage message for glance-cache-manage lists "clean" as an available
command, but this functionality is part of a separate tool,
glance-cache-cleaner.

Remove any references to this to avoid confusion.

DocImpact
Fixes bug 1189451

Change-Id: I2aba8164ab9ef0c3bef31870cb3771233a722d27

commit_message:
Fix SSL certificate CNAME checking

Currently, accessing a host via ip address will pass SSL verification;
the CNAME is not checked as intended as part of verify_callback.

'preverify_ok is True' will always return false (int/bool comparison).
preverify_ok will be 1 if preverification has passed.

Fixes bug 1192229

Change-Id: Ib651548ab4289295a9b92ee039b2aff2d08aba5f

commit_message:
Ensure that files in tests are closed.

This is needed on Pythons which do not have
reference counting GCs (e.g. PyPy).

Change-Id: I5a613e832e9a7a149b3e9317c053c3048f34afcb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 15:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Makes two tests wait for the instance to go ACTIVE

In environments with limited resources, these two
tests can fail intermittently because of some timing
related to resizing. Waiting for the instance to
return to active resolves the resulting 422s.

Change-Id: Ib82f7dcd43f1f7fbba5c5ade44785243d9d1186d
'}]
commit_message:
Makes two tests wait for the instance to go ACTIVE

In environments with limited resources, these two
tests can fail intermittently because of some timing
related to resizing. Waiting for the instance to
return to active resolves the resulting 422s.

Change-Id: Ib82f7dcd43f1f7fbba5c5ade44785243d9d1186d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-08 23:11:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update to latest Oslo rpc modules

* Oslo rpc code now supports heartbeats which will provide Trove
  reliable connections to guests
* Updated the rpc module only via the oslo update procedures

Addresses blueprint trove/update-oslo

Change-Id: I2e25afc0a20d7d834aaf477a32b9a69aa27a9eba
'}]
commit_message:
Update to latest Oslo rpc modules

* Oslo rpc code now supports heartbeats which will provide Trove
  reliable connections to guests
* Updated the rpc module only via the oslo update procedures

Addresses blueprint trove/update-oslo

Change-Id: I2e25afc0a20d7d834aaf477a32b9a69aa27a9eba

    easier to troubleshoot

Add serializer param to RPC service

Allow a serializer to be passed to RPC service class
when it is instantiated.

commit_message:
On reconnecting a FanoutConsumer, don't grow the topic name

Commit 719eba4cae7f2bc11753b17c65c7597b8d6ed72d in oslo-incubator
introduced a small bug on reconnect. Because of the way the topic
was extracted, an extra '_fanout' gets tacked onto the topic name
with each reconnect. A one line fix in code (rpartition) and test
case are needed.

Change-Id: I7b3ca48502c9d5a99802c24dfcec0a1a8292fa07
Fixes: bug #1201552

commit_message:
Fix python 3.3 test configuration

It is no longer necessary to install testrepository from bzr,
so don't. That means we no longer need a separate py33
environment definition, or the special requirements file.

Do not use distribute in the test virtualenvs.

Change-Id: I1c0002d3992e25e7e0927eca85ccd5e4d57ee7d1

commit_message:
Simplify test-requirements for py33

Now that testrepository 0.0.17 is released, we can depend on it to have a
working py33 environment.

Add more documentation

Moved a good portion of README into the sphinx docs. Also started
fleshing out descriptions of how to use things. Also, fix the sphinx
config.

Change-Id: If53dcdaea0a48ef613e3097ab55d34f056160188

Fix disable service docstring

docstring said enable not disable.

commit_message:
Added incremental backup support to Ceph backup driver

The Ceph backup driver is now capable of doing differential
and incremental backups between or within Ceph clusters.

Implements: blueprint cinder-backup-to-ceph

Change-Id: Id59bf1963c6d35aae4baf6f49be17340982c205c

commit_message:
update hacking to 0.6

allow hacking 0.6 to enforce new rules in tempest, especially the
missing license header one.

Change-Id: I787cbc942989b50c57cbc22e4bf1e4956aa64df6

commit_message:
Add global statistic for stress tests

Adds shared memory between all stress action processes and the driver in order
to generate a global statistic. A new command line option is introduced
with this it is possbile to terminate an action if the
specifited number of execution is reached.

Implements: blueprint stress-tests

Conflicts:
tempest/stress/actions/create_destroy_server.py
tempest/stress/actions/volume_create_delete.py
tempest/stress/driver.py
tempest/stress/run_stress.py

Change-Id: I34765932ba93cd6d7f0df23ab97d9483eb459978

commit_message:
Add `default` attribute in hot parameter definition

So `default' in hot is translated to `Default' in cfn

Change-Id: Ifd50dbb993dd0cb177b0e16652c6ef17d12cd2e5
Fixes: bug #1199311

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-06-19 20:43:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

guang-yee: Its been over a week and all the OpenStack service logs are still getting littered w/ PKI error messages on startup. Do you still object to the approach here?'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-06-24 16:56:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I've seen cases in which the signing directory didn't get cleaned up and the Keystone signing certificate was subsequently re-generated. We ended up with invalid (old) certificate in middleware's signing dir and the fetch never happens. User had to manually remove the old certificates before token validation is working again.

Current logic is too fragile to handle these kinds of situations.

This patch is fine for its intended purpose, which is to reduce the warning messages. I am good with that.

But in the log run, we really fix the root of the problem. We need to compare the signer's identifier against the signing certificate we have, if different, then we need to re-fetch the signing certificate."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-06-26 20:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-08 22:24:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

can we just swallow the error messages instead? This is introducing two file operations into the hot path, and I would rather not do that."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:45:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ayoung: See 2b2d0a15311fb1e9b6369374dfd5e0b49e4bf7a8 (in keystone). If we just swallow errors then users will be left confused if there is a real permissions issue (or something else) which causes this to repeatedly fail.

What I'm trying to do here is avoid having ERRORs/WARNINGs in the logs by default but still give a chance for real error messages to bubble up."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:47:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Understood.  I just don't want to introduce the file operations into the hot path.  A better heuristic would be to treat exceptions as not an error until the second consecutive failure.  I'll submit a patch that does that, and it should serve both of our needs."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-07-17 19:37:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ayoung: using exception as part of the happy path seems like a bad idea.

I've been waiting on this for over a month now... would really be nice to get this fix in (having warnings in *all* openstack logs due to PKI is really bad IMO)."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-07-22 17:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

ayoung threw this up so lets go with it:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38185/1'}]

commit_message:
Pre-fetch pki certs to avoid startup ERRORs.

Updates the auth_token middelware so that it pre-fetches the
required PKI certificates before trying to verify a signed
certificate. This avoids logging some really unsightly log ERROR
messages in all of the various openstack service log files
when using keystone w/ PKI.

Fixes LP Bug #1189539.

Change-Id: I79826da6951b72ed61f25553020574063f4b181a

commit_message:
Code dedup in tests for server._action_rebuild

Externed common parts to setUp():
- request body
- request object
- test image UUID
- test image URL
These parts were equal in the most part of the methods.

bp nova-tests-code-duplication

Change-Id: Ie29dd090075915a4065ee395b4e50fc178f72f3b

commit_message:
Set credentials headers if there is no auth token.

Credentials will be set instead of a token for all invocations where
--os-no-client-auth is specified.

Change-Id: I35a81a9518833ce9758228266deb36c8073f9fb8

commit_message:
Set external ID on br-ex

This will enable Neurtron identify that the external bridge is a
Neutron bridge (this is required for bug 1192883)

commit_message:
Allow to set matching_metadata with the cli

This change allows to set the matching_metadata of a alarm like this:

 ceilometer alarm-create --matching-metadata 'key=value' \
      --matching-metadata 'key2=value2' --name 'alarm' ...

Fixes bug #1201877

Change-Id: I22bf261b0a9580a06ae107ed45d082171f21fcc4

messages:

- http://logs.openstack.org/37778/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/4216 : SUCCESS in 2m 45s

- http://logs.openstack.org/37778/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/19414 : SUCCESS in 21m 06s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-19 04:11:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My main issue is, if someone do not like the current E125 checker or has any other style issue, a commit can be rejected by a reason which seams unreasonable to the patch submitter (or other reviewers).

I have doubts the tox.ini is the best place for document it.

IMHO the only fair way to reject any commit bacase of style issue if it is at least documented in a easily visible place.

IMHO even not really fair to reject something if it is copied bad thing, from the same file, but some times happens in another context it is more serious. 

The tempest project should have much more how to contribute documentation anyway.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:36:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

afazekas, I understand your concerns about not gating on E125  but that is out of scope of this patch IMHO.  It sounds like there are good enough reasons not to gate on it for now.

By ignoring E125 I can't imagine we would try to block someone for following it, by not gating we just make it optional.

As for the location, tox.ini is where we keep the list of ignores already, so putting the reason why we ignore somewhere else seems confusing."}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-07-22 11:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

Attila: I think all we are saying here is that reviewers should not reject a patch that "violates" E125.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:49:18.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:49:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

[{'created': '2013-07-18 21:12:09.000000000', 'message': "Document E125 as a won't fix.

As per the discussion in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36788/ the
tempest team does not want to use E125 until
https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/issues/126 is  resolved.

Change-Id: I124e6f14db81d030a470ef3e73a33b15e9dea9ef
"}]
commit_message:
Document E125 as a won't fix.

As per the discussion in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36788/ the
tempest team does not want to use E125 until
https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/issues/126 is  resolved.

Change-Id: I124e6f14db81d030a470ef3e73a33b15e9dea9ef

subject: Unit-ify compute_api delete tests

commit_message:
Unit-ify compute_api delete tests

This makes the delete and soft_delete tests unit-like in nature,
and moves them to test_compute_api, as has been done recently
for others that we're moving to objects.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I5e024871e5159f08cbba05fa261a9a2d08e4b8e5

commit_message:
Convert network API to use InfoCache object

This converts the db.info_cache_update() call in network/api to use
objects.  The save() method has been extended to support what we need
for cells.

Converting to the object allows us to ditch the conductor_api kwarg on
some methods.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I1722c03d20511d67acc0a8947de1d4273dc78597

This looks good but I am concerned about losing the traceback information.  For the IOError it is probably safe to assume the error comes from the cause sited in the bug (tho it may not always).  However for the value error I could see various bugs causing that exception to be raised, in which case we would lose valuable traceback information in the logs.  How do you feel about log.exception() for the ValueError case at least?"}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:36:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks John.  One thing to note is that these type of exceptions are already logged by greenpool regardless of what we say in the upload_utils exception block (see eventlet/greenpool.py line 85).

I don't see any harm with changing the LOG.error to a LOG.exception just in case though (the greenpool logging relies on a DEBUG flag which just happens to be true by default).

My main goal here is to not re-raise a 500 exception in this error case."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-09 13:22:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 13:00:24.000000000', 'message': 'Handle client disconnect during image upload

If a user does a ^C during a chunked image upload, eventlet.wsgi.server
will raise one of ValueError or IOError when trying to read the next
chunk.

Handle this common scenario by raising(logging) a HTTPBadRequest error rather
than HTTPInternalServerError.

Fixes bug 1196953

Change-Id: Ic88b142a40c548141be4b40a15f94b71603814e9
'}, {'created': '2013-07-09 12:36:37.000000000', 'message': 'Handle client disconnect during image upload

If a user does a ^C during a chunked image upload, eventlet.wsgi.server
will raise one of ValueError or IOError when trying to read the next
chunk.

Handle this common scenario by raising(logging) a HTTPBadRequest error rather
than HTTPInternalServerError.

Fixes bug 1196953

Change-Id: Ic88b142a40c548141be4b40a15f94b71603814e9
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 15:26:22.000000000', 'message': 'Handle client disconnect during image upload

If a user does a ^C during a chunked image upload, eventlet.wsgi.server
will raise one of ValueError or IOError when trying to read the next
chunk.

Handle this common scenario by raising(logging) a HTTPBadRequest error rather
than HTTPInternalServerError.

Fixes bug 1196953

Change-Id: Ic88b142a40c548141be4b40a15f94b71603814e9
'}]
commit_message:
Handle client disconnect during image upload

If a user does a ^C during a chunked image upload, eventlet.wsgi.server
will raise one of ValueError or IOError when trying to read the next
chunk.

Handle this common scenario by raising(logging) a HTTPBadRequest error rather
than HTTPInternalServerError.

Fixes bug 1196953

Change-Id: Ic88b142a40c548141be4b40a15f94b71603814e9

commit_message:
Use timeutils.utcnow() throughout the code

timeutils.utcnow() should be used instead of direct calls to
datetime.datetime.utcnow() to make it easy to override its return
value in tests.

Add a hacking rule to prevent regressions.

Fixes bug 1200141.

Change-Id: I170dbd7c9093bd627e2a0d5984b7ad1bf105c8d5

commit_message:
Add a lockfile.

The scripts run by os-refresh-config generally expect to be running
only once. This will ensure that. Because we use /var/run, this also
now assumes that os-refresh-config is run by root. Otherwise one must
pass in a different --lockfile path.

Change-Id: I33cbb065d6bc32c87f5e72132fceef9df82a190d

commit_message:
Add unittest like output for testr-full in tox

This commit adds real time output similar to that when running with
nose so that it's possible to watch the status of the job when using
testr with tempest.

Change-Id: I7a65be714627692ad80b3640af0ee617fd4697a9

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-19 08:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

I have one question.

I was thinker about just follow the logic nothing-suspicions at first look, it used by nova since long, and Jenkins will say no if anything goes wrong and we can fix it.

Long time ago a suspicious code come from nova and merged. 
I was not allowed to fix/modify it before I have the change merged in nova. 

Is this code part must be the same as used by nova ?

Personally, I do not have time to fix almost anything in nova, I usually just report the issues.
I have time for tempest/devstack/gate script,
and I do not have time to merge a change any another project especially if they do not have any urgent need for it.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:54:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

So I don't think the colorizer script here needs to be identical to nova's, but I feel that we should start by committing this as it is in nova. Then we can iteratively make improvements to it over time. (and eventually merge them back into nova) But, I don't see the need to change things up front."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:41:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-20 07:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Use subunit colorizer from nova for run_tests.sh

This commit copies the colorizer.py script over from nova and enables
it for testr with run_tests.sh. This enables real time output from
testr about which tests ran and the result with colors.

Change-Id: Idd1b820d103bf4d71f2645e98e86e5fadbd6cb0c

commit_message:
Make InfoCache.network_info be the network model

Instead of storing the DB version of network_info (which is a JSON
version of network.model.NetworkInfo) on the object, go ahead and turn
it into its native object as well.  This means that all uses of the
object don't need to worry about hydrating network_info themselves.

This adjusts all uses in the code understand the old and new ways of
life.

There's also a small issue with the get_by_instance_uuid() method that
would cause a traceback when no entry was found.  This method is not
being used yet anywhere, but this is fixed to raise a NotFound.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I882311c8a9f9df927c5650946e6398eeb33e74d0

commit_message:
Make shelve pass old-world instance object to conductor

The conductor interface for notify_usage_exists() doesn't yet
work with a new-world object, so convert it with the compatibility
function before passing it from shelve().

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I6c2c2dc6dedf521ed7b0c566411d6f0035038b7c

the admin API use the Instance object's save() method.

commit_message:
Make admin API state resets use Instance.save()

This removes the 'update_state' compute API method in favor of having
the admin API use the Instance object's save() method.

This also removes the non-unity cells test for resetting state.  Cells
behavior is tested via tests on Instance.save().

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I28d1ca9d711679cc55375774e879870f457a5b0b

commit_message:
Sync db.models.Instance* with migrations.

This patch syncs models with migrations for:
    - InstanceIdMapping
    - InstanceMetadata
    - InstanceSystemMetadata
    - InstanceTypeExtraSpecs
    - InstanceTypeProjects
    - InstanceTypes
    - InstanceGroupMember
    - InstanceGroupPolicy
    - InstanceGroupMetadata

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Ice28b9d545f60f7df381e3fcf2c86a2b8e7350d3

commit_message:
Change in 'root-passwd' element.

* setup password using parameter 'DIB_PASSWORD'
* add possibility to login as root

Change-Id: I3f7662d9e6561900ca64a15778c6304c0679acbd
Fixes: big #1199970

commit_message:
Correct the action name for admin_actions API v3

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: Idf92a043e8451626a62a651aa532c9ba1e614057

subject: Add cinder_available config option.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6731, 'name': 'Jay Buffington', 'email': 'me@jaybuff.com', 'username': 'jaybuff'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37320/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/4174 : SUCCESS in 3m 02s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37320/1/check/gate-tempest-docs/723 : SUCCESS in 3m 34s

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:36:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

why not autodetect if cinder is listed as an API endpoint and if not skip the appropriate tests instead of adding yet another configuration option for someone to worry about setting."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:44:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the argument was that if cinder is supposed to be there, and is not, that is a bug that should be detected. Is it really a common use case to deploy nova without cinder?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:46:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If the auto-detection fails, for whatever reason, we might not test what we want.

By just using a 'volume' attribute, you can have the test runner to select (discover / filter) on the related service, and exclude/include test cases.

AFAIK it will work when we switch to testr (AFAIK there will be other methods)."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If Autodetection fails that is a bug in autodetection, not a reason not to use it.  If Tempest cannot figure out what services are running from a keystone catalog, then there is something wrong with interoperability and how we use keystone catalogs.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-16 22:35:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe, we actually try to get away from auto-detection in tempest, because we've had issues in the past where we were nicely autodetecting and skipping tests because of broken systems, but it turns out people actually want to test those."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-16 22:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

so I think this raises a different issue about service tags, I think we should actually solve this with having a volume service tag which we could use to run only volume tests, as well as exclude them (with some negative tags)."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-16 22:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sean, in that case I think the real issue is how you do skips.

IMHO tempest should:

* Have as little configuration as possible.
* Generate a report saying what categories of tests were run which were skipped (due to missing support etc)

I do see the value of some configuration, but the configuration should be to define what counts as passing (ex: all tests except for swift and quantum, or all non-admin tests etc).  This way tempest will require minimal configuration to get it up and running, but can still be configured as a automatic test that will error on false negatives.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-16 22:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

but, that *may* be out of the scope of this change.  Although IMHO this is going in the wrong direction'}, {'account_id': 6731, 'date': '2013-07-16 23:30:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Throwing the TestSkipped exception causes ERROR to be printed along with FAILED.  Here's the output I got when I applied this patch, set cinder_available to false and ran the tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_volumes_get test: http://paste.openstack.org/show/40609/

Note the last line is:
    FAILED (errors=2)

Instead I would expect the output to be something like this http://paste.openstack.org/show/40610/ which shows the last line more correctly as:
    OK (SKIP=4)"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-16 23:45:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe, for practical reasons we've steered clear of autodetection (real bugs that went through and broke trunk). Tempest doesn't make a very good gate job with autodetection.

It's a longer discussion, but the mantra of tempest is to not autoconfigure. So yes, that's a far more fundamental discussion outside the scope of this."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-17 06:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

jog0: FYI a tempest configuration helper script and documentation for outside the gate usage will be added to the repo.

I would like to minimize the miss happens on auto-detecion on the gate system, but for an outside-gate usage it can be ok.

I would prefer if an unittest code, would not decide on skip unless it is really necessary. These steps should be aided by the test runner, and/or by the configuration helper script.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think that this is a good conversation to have so I moved it out to the mailing list here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-qa/2013-July/000663.html'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

afazekas, thanks for the clarification that addresses my concerns.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Jay Buffington:
Nice catch I missed a test class in the compute volumes tests.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6731, 'date': '2013-07-17 18:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

You should add cinder_available = True to the [volume] section of etc/tempest.conf.sample'}, {'account_id': 6731, 'date': '2013-07-17 18:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey Matt,

Thanks for adding the missing changes to test_volumes_list tests.  Patch set #2 still doesn't address my issues shown at http://paste.openstack.org/show/40609/  Note that error is seen when running test_volumes_get, although other tests have the same issue.

It looks like this issue is that raising skipException causes the test to ERROR rather than SKIP, so you shouldn't raise skipException."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 19:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-17 19:45:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok I'll update the sample conf to include cinder_available. I'll push an update shortly.

As for you seeing an error, I'm not seeing that on my system when I test with this patch. (See: http://paste.openstack.org/show/40728/ )

I noticed that you are running with python2.6, are you also using the latest version of testtools? This may be a bug with testtools in python 2.6"}, {'account_id': 6731, 'date': '2013-07-18 16:05:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As Matthew pointed out the issue I see with skipException (see http://paste.openstack.org/show/40609/) seems to be a configuration issue on my end.  Matthew suggested it's a py2.6 thing.  Either way, it looks to be unrelated to this commit."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-07-18 20:28:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 21:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

after the testr effort gets sorted I'll take care of that one."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:38:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add cinder_available config option.

This commit adds a new config group service_available that will be
used to specify whether a particular OpenStack project is expected to
be running or not. This group is added with one member cinder which is
used to specify whether cinder is running or not. This replaces the
check in the volume api tests for a cinder endpoint.

Change-Id: Id894fc29ce2635f1f058290d93726e789c909a86

commit_message:
Skip test that is not relevant to Neutron

Neutron does not support DNS domain feature,
thus this test must be skipped in Neutron environment.
Fixes: bug #1202991

Change-Id: I78f4608cce488cd515d72df2178d7a5b45bf2b85

commit_message:
ec2-api: Disable describing of instances using deleted tags as filter.

Previously, one could describe instances using a deleted tag filter
that was once associated to the instance. The current change disables
describing instances via a deleted tag. Also,minor refactor in the
same function.

fixes bug #1197242

Change-Id: Iac6aa85b69d5a6dc563c00f3497cdab08e178ec1

commit_message:
Add ability to factor in per-instance overheads

Currently free memory calculations in the compute layer use a single
value to account for all memory overhead needed by a host.  This value
is: CONF.reserved_host_memory_mb

This patch adds the ability to factor in per-instance virtualization
overheads into usage calculations.  Virtualization overhead may differ
based on the flavor or other factors such as number of vcpus on a host.
This feature's goal is to provide the ability to do more accurate
computations of a host's overhead without having to pre-configure a
best guess in advance.

The actual calculation of overhead is left up to each virt driver to
implement.  This patch defaults to zero overhead for compatibility.

Change-Id: I4febfa2c837e0f80cee85ca74553829c960a3efc

commit_message:
feat(transport): define acceptable integer range

The JSON parser in use (simplejson) supports Python big integers,
while none of the storage drivers can serialize them.  The acceptable
range to both bson and msgpack is -2^63 ~ 2^63-1.

Change-Id: I861201ea5493bbe4e1c0197000edbd8594162047
Fixes: bug #1202846

commit_message:
rename "enable" action to "toggle"

The previous action caused confusion when it was called "enable" in the
WebUI for both a disabled and an enabled user. It created an expectation
that its name would change when the state of the user would change.

Fixes bug 1202187

Change-Id: I620843df730520b55bfb709aaff1d63ce3f6e772

commit_message:
Add dateutil to parse date and time

We need to set datetime fields of sqlalchemy
models using datetime type. dateutil
provides a parser to convert string to
datetime object

fixes LP 1201766

Change-Id: I7e885bfe08959f6d328abb6655a24ff3bb6a7803

commit_message:
Reset the the watch_rule.last_evaluated on start up

This is so we don't fire off alarms when the engine has not been running.

bug 1202552

Change-Id: Ief258fd601b48e2495ac69091a942f23a019e92c

commit_message:
Refactor the code in heat/tests/test_volume.py

The test code in heat/tests/test_volume.py has lots of
duplicated code and logic.

Mixing this kind of thing with code changes/new tests could make things unnecessarily painful in the future e.g. if a patch had to be reverted or when using git bisect, so it's a good policy to avoid such mixing of unrelated changes.

The OpenStack policy on this is a good read, if you haven't seen it already: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

commit_message:
Handle 'detaching' state of Volume

When detaching volume, the state of volume changed from 'in-use'
to 'detaching', and then from 'detaching' to 'available'.
The code used to ignore 'detaching' state by assuming the volume
has been detached when its state is not 'in-use' any more.
Now we take care 'detaching' state and raise error if detaching
failed.

Fixes bug #1197747

Change-Id: I555eea19409142ccb306c0cceaf7c55e71385bc6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-22 08:14:15.000000000', 'message': "Do not automatically start os-refresh-config.

cfn-hup needs to be the only thing running os-refresh-config. Otherwise
the other orc scripts will race with cfn-hup writing out new metadata.
The exception introduced here is to also let crond (which runs cfn-hup)
run os-refresh-config @reboot to seed the configuration.

Without a need to start up automatically, there doesn't seem to be any
good reason to use an upstart job / systemd service unit. Instead we
can just pipe os-refresh-config output to logger.

Also because we have several places to run os-refresh-config, we
need to move the locking into os-refresh-config itself. Please see
https://review.openstack.org/37319 for that change.

Change-Id: Ic35eca943ba76d421b61710b9fff018e17fb40bf

cfn-hup needs to be the only thing running os-refresh-config. Otherwise
the other orc scripts will race with cfn-hup writing out new metadata.

Without a need to start up automatically, there doesn't seem to be any
good reason to use an upstart job / systemd service unit. Instead we
can just pipe os-refresh-config output to logger.

One circular dependency we have to resolve is that cfn-hup is configured
by os-apply-config, which is run by os-refresh-config, which is run
by cfn-hup.

So, to break this loop, we can run os-refresh-config when cfn-hup has
no configuration.

Change-Id: Ic35eca943ba76d421b61710b9fff018e17fb40bf

by os-apply-config, which is normally only run by os-refresh-config. We
can run os-apply-config before orc to configure cfn-hup, but in this
one-time window between first boot and first complete run of orc we may

Change-Id: Ic35eca943ba76d421b61710b9fff018e17fb40bf

by os-apply-config, which is normally only run by os-refresh-config. We
can run os-apply-config before orc to configure cfn-hup, but in this

Change-Id: Ic35eca943ba76d421b61710b9fff018e17fb40bf

commit_message:
Do not automatically start os-refresh-config.

cfn-hup needs to be the only thing running os-refresh-config. Otherwise
the other orc scripts will race with cfn-hup writing out new metadata.
The exception introduced here is to also let crond (which runs cfn-hup)
run os-refresh-config @reboot to seed the configuration.

Without a need to start up automatically, there doesn't seem to be any
good reason to use an upstart job / systemd service unit. Instead we
can just pipe os-refresh-config output to logger.

Also because we have several places to run os-refresh-config, we
need to move the locking into os-refresh-config itself. Please see
https://review.openstack.org/37319 for that change.

Change-Id: Ic35eca943ba76d421b61710b9fff018e17fb40bf

commit_message:
Remove os-refresh-config call from wipe-openstack.

Previously we were running os-refresh-config to make sure we
caught everything that had been refactored into orc scripts. After
analysis, it seems that the only thing we need before init-neutron is
init-neutron-ovs. This is called later in the orc chain, so we have
split wipe-openstack's call to init-neutron out into 85-init-neutron.

In addition, there was a check for "is it already running" behavior that
is no longer needed since we should only have one orc running at a time
with the impending lock change. We have removed that behavior.

Finally the init/wipe scripts don't need to be in the system PATH and thus
have been merged with their orc scripts, which were their only callers.

Change-Id: I407678104353b180102e16894408c3ffa2d7db90

commit_message:
Sync requirements with openstack/requirements

This switches us from the ipaddr lib, to the netaddr lib which is
in use by other openstack projects.

This also means an updated:

- keystoneclient
- hacking
- distribute
- setuptools

Finally, we're violating two new Hacking rules (H231 / H501), so
we cleanup these violations.

Change-Id: I6658a0209fc7f0942188f7c518171e6b1fa2b4aa

fix resource_metadata failure missing image data

When image metadata is missing kernel and ramdisk causes exception.

Fixes bug 1197180

Regarding the templates part: right now the proposal shows one plain copy of a cfn and a HOT template. Is the plan to create documentation on each template here?

I would propose some kind of guide for HOT with only snippets inside, and then pointers to the actual samples in the heat-templates repo. Plus a reference to the actual template spec. So starting point could be some placeholder file that we start filling with content. I could jump in to cover what is implemented today (hello world) and we add to it while implementing more.

Question is: if that makes sense to everyone, should we cover it under the templates topic, or in the howto guide section?

Any thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 6460, 'date': '2013-07-17 21:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
add docs from the heat wiki

updated index.rst to mimic the layout of the keystone docs
updated the structure for troubleshooting
ported howto guides from the heat wiki
ported the troubleshooting page from the heat wiki
updated the nav for the man pages and getting started
added docs for a cfn template and hot template

Change-Id: I14c1b0b6aa6ea3529c4de994851f7a798a3061bf

[{'created': '2013-07-18 18:12:29.000000000', 'message': '3PAR Driver modifications to support QOS

Currently, the OpenStack HP 3PAR Fibre Channel (FC) and iSCSI Drivers
do not support Quality of Service (QoS) extra specs. The QoS settings
added in this patch include;
   maximum MB/second (maxBWS)
   maximum IO/second (maxIOPS)
These new extra specs will be scoped keys, the scoping will be
hp3par:maxIBWS and hp3par:maxIOPS. A new key hp3par:vvs was also
added to allow the admin to predefine QOS settings on a 3PAR
virtual volume set and the any volume created would be a added
to that predefined volume set.

The 3PAR storage arrays set these values on virtual volume sets,
not the actual volume. So the change includes creating a virtual
volume set with these settings and then adding the volume to the
volume set.
1.  Max IO/S & Max MB/S are not QoS guarantees
2.  These are per volume maximums which the 3PAR is guaranteed
not to exceed.
3.  Settings these values does not guarantee these performance
rates will be achievable

DocImpact

Implements blueprint 3par-qos-support

Change-Id: I69031c6d3febe11dd5f9ff17095b86f3fe72a2a4

commit_message:
3PAR Driver modifications to support QOS

Currently, the OpenStack HP 3PAR Fibre Channel (FC) and iSCSI Drivers
do not support Quality of Service (QoS) extra specs. The QoS settings
added in this patch include;
   maximum MB/second (maxBWS)
   maximum IO/second (maxIOPS)
These new extra specs will be scoped keys, the scoping will be
qos:maxBWS and qos:maxIOPS. A new key hp3par:vvs was also
added to allow the admin to predefine QOS settings on a 3PAR
virtual volume set and any volume created would be added
to that predefined volume set.

The 3PAR storage arrays set these values on virtual volume sets,
not the actual volume. So the change includes creating a virtual
volume set with these settings and then adding the volume to the
volume set.
1.  Max IO/S & Max MB/S are not QoS guarantees
2.  These are per volume maximums which the 3PAR is guaranteed
not to exceed.
3.  Settings these values does not guarantee these performance
rates will be achievable

DocImpact

Implements blueprint 3par-qos-support

Change-Id: I69031c6d3febe11dd5f9ff17095b86f3fe72a2a4

To test the patch with devstack you need to run at least two lbaas agents. 
In order to run the second agent on the same host do the following:
 - copy quantum.conf from /etc/quantum/quantum.conf 
   and lbaas_agent.ini from /etc/quantum/services/loadbalancer/haproxy/
 - change "host" parameter in quantum.conf copy like "host = host2"
 - change "loadbalancer_state_path" in lbaas_agent.ini copy like "loadbalancer_state_path = /opt/stack/data/quantum/lbaas_agent2"
 - run the second agent with "cd /opt/stack/quantum && python /opt/stack/quantum/bin/quantum-lbaas-agent --config-file path/to/copy/quantum.conf --config-file path/to/copy/lbaas_agent.ini"

Then you can use following script to create several loadbalancers (given that chance scheduler is used 3 or 4 loadbalancers should be enough):
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/38946/

Now you can ensure that both /opt/stack/data/quantum/lbaas and /opt/stack/data/quantum/lbaas_agent2 directories contain configs of loadbalancers scheduled to the corresponding agents.
You can also continue testing trying to stop/start agents and then modifying loadbalancers to see if agents correctly handle their loadbalancers.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

To test the patch with devstack you need to run at least two lbaas agents. 
In order to run the second agent on the same host do the following:
 - copy quantum.conf from /etc/quantum/quantum.conf 
   and lbaas_agent.ini from /etc/quantum/services/loadbalancer/haproxy/
 - change "host" parameter in quantum.conf copy like "host = host2"
 - change "loadbalancer_state_path" in lbaas_agent.ini copy like "loadbalancer_state_path = /opt/stack/data/quantum/lbaas_agent2"
 - run the second agent with "cd /opt/stack/quantum && python /opt/stack/quantum/bin/quantum-lbaas-agent --config-file path/to/copy/quantum.conf --config-file path/to/copy/lbaas_agent.ini"
Then you can use following script to create several loadbalancers (given that chance scheduler is used 3 or 4 loadbalancers should be enough):
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/38946/
Now you can ensure that both /opt/stack/data/quantum/lbaas and /opt/stack/data/quantum/lbaas_agent2 directories contain configs of loadbalancers scheduled to the corresponding agents. You can also continue testing trying to stop/start agents and then modifying loadbalancers to see if agents correctly handle their loadbalancers.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

pool-agent binding deletion is ensured by ondelete='CASCADE' option for pool_id and agent_id in the model. No special code for this deletion is added within this patch so I believe there is no need for a special test case"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (5 inline comments)

- http://logs.openstack.org/32137/7/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/34072 : SUCCESS in 19m 46s
'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The impact of code changes got me thinking that we should probably revisit the implementation of the agent scheduler extension. I see two fundamentals problem with this approach: a) any agent scheduling addition made to the extension is irrevocably inherited by all plugins; even though the risk of regression or behavior change is minimal, I personally see this as bad exploitation of OO principles; b) there is no way from a client standpoint to understand what scheduling capability is actually supported and which is not. For instance, unless the plugin explicitly overrode base methods and raised NotImplementedError for the unsupported ones, the client will have no way to figure this out. In this regard, we have also another problem:  currently all Exceptions look to be masked as 500 (Internal Server Error), which is clearly not ideal.

In my view, we should go back to the drawing table on this one. I am happy to help with the coding/testing as I have been having similar thoughts in the context of blueprint nvp-agent-scheduler-extension, where NVP does not need to support L3 agent scheduling extensions."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I am not suggesting to address this in this patch. I would propose to do it in the context of another patch and rebase this one on top of the other. I think that's the cleaner way to do it. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Yes, it would be good to gather input around this, but I hope that your review as well as mine (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34675/) won't get delayed too much. I guess we could always have a clean-up patch afterwards..."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I filed bug 1196806 to separate dhcp and l3 agent scheduling. I believe it won't take too much time and hopefully the patch will be ready in a couple of days. LBaaS agent scheduling will become a separate extension as well."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Armando, thanks for your input! I also thought about this problem when implementing current patch and I cannot think of anything better than having separate extension/db_mixin for every kind of agent being scheduled (this includes separate extensions for l3 and dhcp agents). We can group them in common files and have some common scheduler db mixin to make it easier to add new agent schedulers. Anyway I would like to hear Yong's opinion on this first"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Armando,
>  any agent scheduling addition made to the extension is irrevocably inherited by all plugins; even though the risk of regression or behavior change is minimal, I personally see this as bad exploitation of OO principles

I tend to agree with this.
For this patch it could be quite easily solved by the following changes:
 * provide LbaasAgentSchedulerDbMixin instance to the resource controller
 * do not inherit lbaas plugin from LbaasAgentSchedulerDbMixin 
Also, in this case the name of this mixin needs to be changed.

I'd avoid making further generic changes to agent scheduling framework as it's out of scope of this patch."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add agent scheduling for LBaaS namespace agent

- adds simple chance scheduling on create pool operation
- adds PoolsLoadbalancerAgentBinding db table
- adds lbaas_agentscheduler extension to list pools hosted by a particular agent
  and to get an agent hosting a particular pool
- adds agent notifiers mapping to AgentSchedulerDbMixin to make it easier
  for services to add their agent notifiers to the core plugin

Implements blueprint lbaas-agent-scheduler
Change-Id: Id98649fd5c7873dcd5be1a2b117b8bed25f06cc2

commit_message:
Add agent scheduling for LBaaS namespace agent

- adds simple chance scheduling on create pool operation
- adds PoolsLoadbalancerAgentBinding db table
- adds lbaas_agentscheduler extension to list pools hosted by a particular agent
  and to get an agent hosting a particular pool
- adds agent notifiers mapping to AgentSchedulerDbMixin to make it easier
  for services to add their agent notifiers to the core plugin

Implements blueprint lbaas-agent-scheduler
Change-Id: Id98649fd5c7873dcd5be1a2b117b8bed25f06cc2

[{'created': '2013-07-17 06:50:52.000000000', 'message': "make rejoin-stack.sh keep the same service tags

Currently rejoin-stack.sh can not keep the same screen service tags
as the first you deploy openstack due to that the stack-screenrc lack
proper command to configure screen's hardstatus. just delete the old
stack-screenrc so that function screen_rc can write proper initialize
command into stack-screenrc.

fix bug 1182597

Change-Id: I4cb4c6ded93a5c7b0bd39d65a754ddf86553463d
"}]
commit_message:
make rejoin-stack.sh keep the same service tags

Currently rejoin-stack.sh can not keep the same screen service tags
as the first you deploy openstack due to that the stack-screenrc lack
proper command to configure screen's hardstatus. just delete the old
stack-screenrc so that function screen_rc can write proper initialize
command into stack-screenrc.

fix bug 1182597

Change-Id: I4cb4c6ded93a5c7b0bd39d65a754ddf86553463d

commit_message:
We force installs via pip, we should declare it

pbr contains code that very explicitly uses pip, which means that pip is
a requirement.

Note to packagers: it is possible to skip uses of pip, meaning that you
can totally use pbr-based things without needing to have them pip
install things.

Change-Id: Ifa472f344489295a5b8a1910bff2672087653547

[{'created': '2013-07-02 16:40:18.000000000', 'message': "Remove .mo files from Horizon git

Horizon source code is embedding the .mo files in its Git
repository, though they should be generated out of the .po
files, and so shouldn't be there. Storing the .mo files
poses 2 problems: we can't ensure that the .mo are built
from source, and .mo files can generate merge conflicts.
This patch removes the .mo files, and adds the build of the
.mo files when generating the sdist tarball, or when doing

Fixes Bug1196982

Change-Id: I6dea82e5cd06b7dea6eb8b209a786999d2fc85e0

repository, though they should be generated out of the .po
files, and so shouldn't be there. Storing the .mo files
poses 2 problems: we can't ensure that the .mo are built
from source, and .mo files can generate merge conflicts.
This patch removes the .mo files, and adds the build of the
.mo files when generating the sdist tarball, or when doing
python setup.py install.

Fixes Bug1196982

Change-Id: I6dea82e5cd06b7dea6eb8b209a786999d2fc85e0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove .mo files from Horizon git

Horizon source code is embedding the .mo files in its Git
repository, though they should be generated out of the .po
files, and so shouldn't be there. Storing the .mo files
poses 2 problems: we can't ensure that the .mo are built
from source, and .mo files can generate merge conflicts.
This patch removes the .mo files, and adds the build of the
.mo files when generating the sdist tarball, or when doing
python setup.py install.

Fixes Bug1196982

Change-Id: I6dea82e5cd06b7dea6eb8b209a786999d2fc85e0

commit_message:
Use testtools for test base class.

testtools is a step towards testr/subunit test processing. It also
lays the groundwork for using things like addCleanup and fixtures
in the test suites. testtools is a bit pedantic about upcalling,
so the setUp/tearDown methods have all gotten upcalls.

Change-Id: I419c135523b3acbb614c05d4ce0a08371a2bfd3d

'}, {'created': '2013-07-04 00:40:57.000000000', 'message': 'Added new `["openstack"]["caching"]` attributes

* Updated version to 0.4.0 due to changes to `#memcached_servers`.
* The `#memcached_servers` method no longer accepts a role, and the override
  attributes were changed to make consistent with `#rabbit_servers`, and our
  wrapper cookbook conventions.
* There was a use case to handle an empty `[]` passed into memcached_servers
  attribute.  Don't feel this is necessary, since one is explicitly setting it,
  for it to be used.
* We need to cleanup the cookbooks which use `#memcached_servers`, and make
  the use of memcached optional.

Change-Id: Ic818397125cefed4b37c71af855b2478838566c8
'}]
commit_message:
Added new `["openstack"]["caching"]` attributes

* Updated version to 0.4.0 due to changes to `#memcached_servers`.
* The `#memcached_servers` method no longer accepts a role, and the override
  attributes were changed to make consistent with `#rabbit_servers`, and our
  wrapper cookbook conventions.
* There was a use case to handle an empty `[]` passed into memcached_servers
  attribute.  Don't feel this is necessary, since one is explicitly setting it,
  for it to be used.
* We need to cleanup the cookbooks which use `#memcached_servers`, and make
  the use of memcached optional.

Change-Id: Ic818397125cefed4b37c71af855b2478838566c8

commit_message:
Add the autoindex support from pbr

Now that we have a common sphinx home, move the logic for doing advanced
Sphinx things here and just have pbr do the work to enable those
features as needed.

Change-Id: I7dfff9401e7dc7913c370238921d918c2124157c

commit_message:
Adds tests for tags in boto (EC2 API)

The EC2 API now supports tagging instances. This adds a simple
test for creation, retrieval, and updating tags.

Fixes bug #1201051

Change-Id: Icca21ea29f95683403004a0a7b079a10446d9317

commit_message:
Ignore project creator while generating AUTHORS

New projects created by OpenStack Project Creator
<openstack-infra@lists.openstack.org>, so it'll be better to remove it
from the AUTHORS file.

Change-Id: I32975bd430635a38c7e737e70f381f7b07c6ed0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-21 14:59:30.000000000', 'message': 'Do not assume the tests run as jenkins

Use $HOME instead of "/home/jenkins" in the generated configuration
files to let the script be run as a user other than jenkins.

Change-Id: I9413591bb4a7d821382eae6dc3edd1df0c41a5e6
'}]
commit_message:
Do not assume the tests run as jenkins

Use $HOME instead of "/home/jenkins" in the generated configuration
files to let the script be run as a user other than jenkins.

Change-Id: I9413591bb4a7d821382eae6dc3edd1df0c41a5e6

"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-20 00:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Assuming this passes all tests, meaning this actually works.  We get a pretty decent speedup.

Quick measurements give the overhead incurred from this to be 0m0.046s, vs 0.250 or so without it.

This overhead appears to be all python startup time.

$ time sudo python -c "print 'nothing'"
nothing

real    0m0.053s
user    0m0.028s
sys     0m0.020s


$ time   /usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap 
NOTHING

real    0m0.042s
user    0m0.036s
sys     0m0.008s




Without this patch:

vagrant@precise64:/opt/stack/nova$ time   /usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap 
NOTHING

real    0m0.192s
user    0m0.152s
sys     0m0.036s'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-07-20 07:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Replace entry_points console_scripts

The console scripts generated by entry_points are too complex for
our needs and make things run slowly in service of a multi-version
install that we don't use.

Instead, install a simple script which just does a direct import.

Change-Id: I1ec46837cea07db514f2fb6338c7bced34a83c4a

to say "pbr=True" in setup.py and then to list the hook in setup.cfg
now that d2to1 is in the tree.

Change-Id: Ie33d3e08d5a4133f5caf2613859919ce4f02c4a0
'}, {'created': '2013-07-21 18:41:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the need to specify the pbr hook

If you're running pbr codepaths, you want the hook. There is no need
to say "pbr=True" in setup.py and then to list the hook in setup.cfg

commit_message:
Remove the need to specify the pbr hook

If you're running pbr codepaths, you want the hook. There is no need
to say "pbr=True" in setup.py and then to list the hook in setup.cfg
now that d2to1 is in the tree.

Change-Id: Ie33d3e08d5a4133f5caf2613859919ce4f02c4a0

commit_message:
Move d2to1 more into the source tree

When we merged in d2to1, we kept it separate, but I don't think there
is a great benefit to doing that.

Change-Id: I3972b3132619e8e2dd7e362ca5fe9d1e3add43b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-21 19:36:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix python 3.3 test requirements

Python 3.3 can't install testrepository from bzr, so use
the officially released version instead.

Change-Id: I0c56f9cde643ef8580ab305080bc62b87809bf7e
"}, {'created': '2013-07-21 19:52:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix python 3.3 tests

We can go back to using the official release of
testrepository for testing under python 3, so
do.

Make python 3.3 part of the default environment
set for anyone running all of the tests.

Change-Id: I0c56f9cde643ef8580ab305080bc62b87809bf7e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python 3.3 tests

We can go back to using the official release of
testrepository for testing under python 3, so
do.

Make python 3.3 part of the default environment
set for anyone running all of the tests.

Change-Id: I0c56f9cde643ef8580ab305080bc62b87809bf7e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-18 07:45:19.000000000', 'message': 'Continue creating resource if resource id is None

So the condition to create resource is one of resource id, resource
status, resource action is None.

Change-Id: Id79988560e105c254d304e30d598427a2bbc5b26
Fixes: bug #1202492
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 10:48:43.000000000', 'message': 'Set action status to INIT COMPLETE after resource destroyed

So the destroyed resource can be created again.

Change-Id: Id79988560e105c254d304e30d598427a2bbc5b26
Fixes: bug #1202492
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 20:34:04.000000000', 'message': 'Allow resource with None id to be recreated

So the destroyed resource can be recreated, and HARestarted main logic
resource destory and create can work.

Change-Id: Id79988560e105c254d304e30d598427a2bbc5b26
Fixes: bug #1202492
'}, {'created': '2013-07-19 02:24:01.000000000', 'message': 'Reset state before resource recreation

So the destroyed resource can be recreated, and HARestarted main logic
resource destory and create can work.

Change-Id: Id79988560e105c254d304e30d598427a2bbc5b26
Fixes: bug #1202492
'}, {'created': '2013-07-19 02:24:01.000000000', 'message': 'Reset state before resource recreation

So the destroyed resource can be recreated, and HARestarted main logic
resource destory and create can work.

Change-Id: Id79988560e105c254d304e30d598427a2bbc5b26
Fixes: bug #1202492
'}]
commit_message:
Reset state before resource recreation

So the destroyed resource can be recreated, and HARestarted main logic
resource destory and create can work.

Change-Id: Id79988560e105c254d304e30d598427a2bbc5b26
Fixes: bug #1202492

[{'created': '2013-07-19 02:45:06.000000000', 'message': "Configure standalone pipelines for cfn and cloudwatch.

This allows waitconditions and cloud watch data to authenticate
using just the ec2token middleware. Stacks have been successfully launched
with a standalone heat onto an external grizzly openstack, including working
waitconditions and watch data.

This means that currently when in standalone mode, heat-cfn cannot
authenticate since it defaults to auth strategy keystone (and it appears
that auth strategy ec2 signing has not been implemented yet). This case
is sufficiently obscure that it most likely won't affect anyone at this
stage.

Implements blueprint heat-standalone

Change-Id: I7d096b11e70c234d0b2322c93bf5f4d4e6b01b4f
"}]
commit_message:
Configure standalone pipelines for cfn and cloudwatch.

This allows waitconditions and cloud watch data to authenticate
using just the ec2token middleware. Stacks have been successfully launched
with a standalone heat onto an external grizzly openstack, including working
waitconditions and watch data.

This means that currently when in standalone mode, heat-cfn cannot
authenticate since it defaults to auth strategy keystone (and it appears
that auth strategy ec2 signing has not been implemented yet). This case
is sufficiently obscure that it most likely won't affect anyone at this
stage.

Implements blueprint heat-standalone

Change-Id: I7d096b11e70c234d0b2322c93bf5f4d4e6b01b4f

commit_message:
Set role headers from ec2 authentication.

Without this roles are not available in the context when
ec2token middleware is used on its own.

Change-Id: I1214e44c588f547ee6f90f0f71a085f786e7ea7f

commit_message:
Set tenant headers from ec2 authentication.

Without this, ec2token middleware on its own doesn't set enough
headers to perform heat requests.

Change-Id: I7a0867196741c0df222d491fb1bfbe203158032c

'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Keystone We shouldn't really have "views" as  such, as we are not doing UI.  The keystone client and the web UI will have views into Keystone, but we should be providing only a remoting API for a limited set of views.

I suspect there is something wrong with how we are doing our dictionary conversions, but this code seems too verbose.  I think that the keystone/common/model.py code is already attempting to provide the abstraction that you are attempting to do here.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-09 21:38:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

TL;DR; common/models.py don't do anything and aren't used, we do views already we call them v2 and v3 in json and xml and most of the verbosity is because there is no common model base class yet.

So i disagree. 

The models in keystone/common/models.py don't actually provide anything. So far they are used within the ldap backend but there is no enforcement of required keys or optional, it doesn't validate (and there is a bug from ldap i'll file later today that this would have caught).

Regarding views, i wasn't proposing this at the moment, but to go down that path i think they are a good idea. I'd love to get this is a v3 rendering vs a v2 rendering vs straight out of the database out of the logic of the code. So we are doing views, they are just versions and json vs xml. If this logic wan't to live on the model that's ok to start, so something like credential.render_v3(). Also you have already proposed a limited html front end for keystone. 

Regarding verbosity, yes credentials are a really simple model that probably don't need this much attention. This is why i used this one so it is fairly clear the proposed interface and how it hooks in.

Now if we subclass the common model parts out of what is in the credential, all the properties can go into a list, create, update, and self.destroy would disappear.and essentially you are just mapping a couple of functions to their api equivalents. Again credential is not the best target for this, however it is a small price to pay to abstract some token or user management out of the controller logic."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-15 02:19:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So for the time being lets just wait and see what: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ObjectProposal looks like when it gets to oslo."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:15:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Just a couple NITs inline"}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-22 00:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Going to wait and see what https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ObjectProposal brings'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 07:56:58.000000000', 'message': "Create a Credential Model.

So far we kind of have the C in MVC and everything else is a jumble.
This results in things like when working with tokens having to know the
structure of the dictionary and thus constantly checking for V2 or V3.

Obviously this doesn't touch token and in the case of credential it's
not really all that useful. However it is an easy target to show the idea,
as the more useful ones like identity and token are undergoing large
changes that I don't want to get in the way of.

By inheriting the model from dict I expect that this transition can be
handled in pieces. Parts of the model will probably need to be
abstracted but I expect the function names to remain as they are.

Change-Id: I46e6c9fd9213fb0c05ac40710130f3614af4971e
Starts: blueprint object-models

commit_message:
Create a Credential Model.

So far we kind of have the C in MVC and everything else is a jumble.
This results in things like when working with tokens having to know the
structure of the dictionary and thus constantly checking for V2 or V3.

Obviously this doesn't touch token and in the case of credential it's
not really all that useful. However it is an easy target to show the idea,
as the more useful ones like identity and token are undergoing large
changes that I don't want to get in the way of.

By inheriting the model from dict I expect that this transition can be
handled in pieces. Parts of the model will probably need to be
abstracted but I expect the function names to remain as they are.

Change-Id: I46e6c9fd9213fb0c05ac40710130f3614af4971e
Starts: blueprint object-models

commit_message:
Only create the period watch task if there is a watch in the stack

This prevents unneccessary greentheads polling the db.

bug 1202031
Change-Id: I065955d03df543df40af285f87a7fd3dfa779413

commit_message:
Wrap the watch rule start in a method

This is the first step in making the watch task dependant on:
1) whether we even have an alarm in the stack
2) whether the alarm is a ceilometer alarm

The test confirms the current behaviour, which is a periodic task
is created whether or not a watch is in the stack.

bug 1202031
Change-Id: Iebb948f788270fca0dbef61a2e122fe3900d84b2

commit_message:
Merge " Cleanup docstrings " from keystone/common/cms.py

In an attempt to unify both implementations in order to
be able to remove one of the duplicated ones, merge the
changes from this commit in keystone:

    Author: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>
    Date:   Fri May 24 11:36:44 2013 -0500

    Cleanup docstrings (flake8 H401, H402, H403, H404)

Change-Id: Ib23c9ab5066cfdcdda4e07cd30fa8f6ff47949bd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 15:43:05.000000000', 'message': 'Raise key length defaults

Extend RSA keylength to 2048 bits by default,
as the previous default of 1024 bit is considered
weak since 12/31/2010.

Also unify the message_md to the openssl builtin
default.

Fixes bug 1103002

Change-Id: I619fc32b62beab4458ee6f21bf8dc7499fe400d7
'}]
commit_message:
Raise key length defaults

Extend RSA keylength to 2048 bits by default,
as the previous default of 1024 bit is considered
weak since 12/31/2010.

Also unify the message_md to the openssl builtin
default.

Fixes bug 1103002

Change-Id: I619fc32b62beab4458ee6f21bf8dc7499fe400d7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-21 21:02:33.000000000', 'message': 'Cannot refer to attributes in other cookbooks

The way that Chef11 handles setting default attributes from
references to other cookbook defaults is broken -- or at least
non-intuitive. We need to set string defaults for things otherwise
on compilation, the defaults will contain NilClass values.

Change-Id: I78d1671e5ecc6dfd6cdb04f4218341cbb6594d33
'}]
commit_message:
Cannot refer to attributes in other cookbooks

The way that Chef11 handles setting default attributes from
references to other cookbook defaults is broken -- or at least
non-intuitive. We need to set string defaults for things otherwise
on compilation, the defaults will contain NilClass values.

Change-Id: I78d1671e5ecc6dfd6cdb04f4218341cbb6594d33

commit_message:
Fix integer_types type under python 3

Set the integer_types variable to the same kind of object
under python 3 and 2 so that when we go to manipulate it
later it works.

Change-Id: I8f9db1d76931ef834645095952f71415d98f0b5c

commit_message:
Cookbook defines rabbit settings

When setting a coobook's default attributes from the attributes
on another cookbook, it becomes impossible to override from
a wrapper cookbook.  We just started working on wrapper cookbooks,
and attempting to override `openstack["mq"]` settings proved
unsuccessful.

Since the community actively has people looking into wrapper
cookbooks, this fix seems reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie23ef1e04e5c29eeb99635dc5850de4acbaff1f7

commit_message:
Cookbook defines rabbit settings

When setting a coobook's default attributes from the attributes
of another cookbook, it becomes impossible to override from
a wrapper cookbook.  We just started working on wrapper cookbooks,
and attempting to override `openstack["mq"]` settings proved
unsuccessful.

Since the community actively has people looking into wrapper
cookbooks, this fix seems reasonable.

Change-Id: Ibadc4bddd1bc66638cd826f5bc6e3f6ee3a38179

commit_message:
Add [assignment].driver to sample config

There's a new config option [assignment].driver that wasn't included
in the sample config file. This makes it more difficult than necessary
for deployers to configure.

Fixes bug 1202778

Change-Id: I04b09c214b9ea997d8f540a72978ce9b19b4138d
