commit_message:
Return correct link for effective group roles in GET /role_assignments

The assignment link returned for roles that are included by virtue of
group membership should refer to the group assignment that led to this
role, rather than a direct user assignment.

Fixes bug 1201374

Change-Id: Ic649e7eb4633e258264f27280d938a08af380921

commit_message:
Add discover to test-requirements.

Apparently this was always supposed to be required for py26 tests with
testresources however only recently does a newer version actually fail
without it.

Change-Id: I9c7bc83d75a964152ad5772554f9693706a2a2d4

I kind of had the same suspicion.

I am therefore abandoning this patch.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-21 16:07:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

To provide more context, the rationale was to find a way for not doings all the model joins for eager loading when they were not needed - possibly avoiding adding more 'magic' to db_base_plugin_v2, which is the reason why the related patch (I think) was criticized. With the proposed changes to db_base_plugin_v2 however, it also ended up adding unwanted 'magic'.

The alternative would have been to leverage model properties directly, which is what will be done instead for fixing this bug."}]

a plugin might specifies which relationships should be eagerly loaded
when a db operation is performed.

commit_message:
Avoid performing extra query for fetching port security binding

Bug 1201957

Beyond achieving the goal of avoiding an extra query for retrieving the
port security bindings for both networks and ports, this patch also
extends the facilities offered by the db base class in a way such that
a plugin might specifies which relationships should be eagerly loaded
when a db operation is performed.
This will allow to perform the full joined load when doing, for instance
a get_network call, whereas it will be possible to specify which joins
are needed when performing a call to the 'private' method _get_network.

Change-Id: I5aa773d4acda9b45e758c72c263419b6dc165931

commit_message:
Add missing tests for console_* methods.

There was no tests in test_db_api for console_* methods.
Add tests to ensure that all works.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: Ic3d5a3dd60ba50b561126279c00ca07022aaa20e

commit_message:
Remove openstack.common.cfg.

We migrated to oslo.config a while back, this was leftover.

Additionally, cleanup the openstack-common.conf file.

Change-Id: Ic24f444a66a0221a0618133e30e0f762b0f599e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 19:05:36.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patches adds network and block device information to the signature
of the power_on method on the virtualization driver. The relevant call
sites are also modified to provide the required information. The libvirt
implementation of power_on has been altered to re-establish network and
volume related connections.

Fixes bug: 1188326

(cherry picked from commit db3989586a8d5bbbcf857b9294a124ecc5fc57e8)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

(Includes some collateral additions for console tests in the vmware
 tests.)

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 19:56:54.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patches adds network and block device information to the signature
of the power_on method on the virtualization driver. The relevant call
sites are also modified to provide the required information. The libvirt
implementation of power_on has been altered to re-establish network and
volume related connections.

Fixes bug: 1188326

(cherry picked from commit db3989586a8d5bbbcf857b9294a124ecc5fc57e8)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh volume connections when starting instances

This patches adds network and block device information to the signature
of the power_on method on the virtualization driver. The relevant call
sites are also modified to provide the required information. The libvirt
implementation of power_on has been altered to re-establish network and
volume related connections.

Fixes bug: 1188326

(cherry picked from commit db3989586a8d5bbbcf857b9294a124ecc5fc57e8)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

(Includes some collateral additions for console tests in the vmware
 tests.)

Change-Id: If617b570e082e3aa321414a2680a3aa0754f6153

commit_message:
Keystone authentiation.

Enabled ACL and implemented a hook for configuring
request context.

Implemented a hook that rejects all non-admin requests.

Change-Id: Ie436d4b41ef9fb54b33f5a7dad77c3e46a26385a

commit_message:
Remove DnsmasqFilter and DeprecatedDnsmasqFilter

EnvFilter supersedes both, so remove them as all
usages have been converted to EnvFilter.

Change-Id: I5acb0c924815caae1f96ed2fa6ee8b1f7ed93cf4

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-10 03:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I agree this is better than updating cfg.CONF or raising an exception when lock_path is not given. lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-10 05:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

No, this would be a security issue

/tmp is world writable, so using a predictable directory name there would allow users to DOS the service simply

We should just get rid of the support for local_lock_path=None

See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo/+bug/1065531'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-10 05:31:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mark, Then I guess tempfile.mkdtemp() didn't make sense in the first place since anybody can wipe out /tmp. For bug #1065531, do we need to check the owner of the lock_path then?"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-10 05:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-07-10 15:14:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay, I wasn't sure if that would be an issue here, but I suppose at the very least we could get DoS'd by someone creating bogus lock files.  I'll change it to throw an exception if lock_path is not set since I don't see a sane way to do this without it.

I do think it would be good to check the permissions of the lock_path and at least log a warning if they're unsafe, but that's probably a separate change."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-07-10 15:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 16:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix locking bug

When lock_path is not set, lockutils creates a new temp dir for
each new call to synchronized.  This results in no actual lock
enforcement.  Require setting of lock_path by throwing an
exception if it is not found.

Fixes bug 1065531
Fixes bug 1162047

Change-Id: I178684a1d8649b5bcfcb768be0a68c8efa3f00e4

commit_message:
Fix stylistic problems with help text

The help text for the backdoor_port configuration option was a little
groddy.  This reformats it to clean it up a little.  Some punctuation
is also added to clarify the meaning of the text.

Change-Id: Ie61be9f0d08cd9c2485177b207216b3b775acd04

commit_message:
fix use of locals() in strings

hacking 0.6 brings in H501, don't use locals() in strings, as it
has the ability to hide errors. This fixes it in preparation of
landing hacking 0.6.

Change-Id: I7972befbb945a27ed8aa601975205736038eefa2

My -1 is twitching but I'm going to stay at 0 to ask some questions.

1) This makes userdata more complicated to debug. Perhaps we should also provide a tiny script that will print it out, uncompressed, or at the very least a README in the dir explaining how to view it?

2) New functionality without tests?"}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-06-26 14:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

> This is pre-work for compressing the entire cfn tools into 
> the userdata.

Is there a blueprint for this?'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-06-26 18:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yes blueprint gzip-userdata'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-06-26 18:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> yes blueprint gzip-userdata

I think the query was re the compressing cfntools into the userdata?

If so then this seems to be the related BP:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/cloudinit-cfntools'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-06-26 23:18:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'll give into the twitch. The -1 is mostly for tests, though the code itself looks fine. Having said that, I agree with Clint regarding the debugging issue, but more than that I question if this will ultimately allow for pushing tools up to instances since most running clouds have size restrictions around user data/injected files that preclude doing much more than we already do, especially when the user data gets complex."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-06-27 04:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Randall,

Regarding pushing tools into the instance, there is a separate blueprint cloudinit-cfntools which remains unimplemented.  That blueprint is in the discussion phase so please feel free to discuss on that blueprint directly.  My take on that particular feature is that it is not mandatory, and being optional, causes no harm for operators that wish to deploy without it.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-06-27 04:52:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Clint,

I am not certain if there are test cases to test the cloudinit mime encoding/decoding (with or without compression), but I'll look into writing such a test case.

A tool to decode the userdata mime blob might make sense although that almost seems like a new blueprint mime-decoder since that feature doesn't exist in the code today.

Note I believe that even with the added complexity, we gain in our ability to support larger templates.  For example The WordPress_NoKey template mime blob goes from 6k to 4k with this code."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-06-27 17:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It is not so much the multi-part mime I need help decoding, but the compressed sections. I can look at a multi-part mime file and read the parts right now. However, they will just be giant blocks of base64 after this change. I find myself reading the cloud-init userdata from time to time (usually debugging problems with heat/heat-cfntools...) and this would be very difficult w/o such a tool.

Speaking of base64.. have we looked into using Base85 instead?'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-02 19:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Regarding base85, the only code I can find that implements this is :

https://code.google.com/p/python-mom/source/browse/mom/codec/base85.py

While the license is compatible, we would have to base 64 encode this blob to base85 decode the other blobs.  Seems like needless complication.  May be worthy of consideration once base85 is built into the email package.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-02 19:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-02 20:37:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Also, not renaming part-handler.py -> part_handler.py means the git history is lost. Is that an oversight or is there a practical reason it wasn't renamed?"}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-07 02:51:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Clint,

Not sure what happened with the rename.  I used git mv which should have worked properly.  Perhaps a rebase along the way damaged the patch.  I'll correct.  I'll also remove the wrap_open call.  Both myself and Steve Hardy couldn't figure out how to wrap all of the various IO with compression to actually test compress/decompress and thought that would be better handled as part of the functional testing via the tempest gate."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-07 03:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Just fyi since I am one of the contributors to cloudinit.

https://bazaar.launchpad.net/~cloud-init-dev/cloud-init/trunk/view/head:/cloudinit/user_data.py#L66 
https://bazaar.launchpad.net/~cloud-init-dev/cloud-init/trunk/view/head:/cloudinit/user_data.py#L270

The userdata there can already be gzip compressed. So you may not need to make your own compression/decompression handlers??'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:17:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't understand why this is necessary.  This change might make more sense to me in the context of the other work that will be done as part of the cloudinit-cfntools blueprint."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

With or without blueprint cloudinit-cfntools, the result of this change is a net increase in the amount of available storage space for user data.  These two blueprints are completely orthogonal.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-10 21:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-07-10 21:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 23:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-11 09:55:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(12 inline comments)

Some issues inline, but it also seems like there ought to be a way to get cloud-init to deal with this for us (suggestion also inline).

Joshua, can you confirm whether cloud-init will recursively explode MIME Multipart archives?"}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-11 22:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Zane,
cloudinit does not recursively explode mime blobs - seems like something I would have (and did) tried ;)'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-11 22:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-12 00:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 01:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/34476/6/check/gate-heat-pep8/4148 : SUCCESS in 2m 05s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34476/6/check/gate-heat-python26/4082 : SUCCESS in 4m 50s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34476/6/check/gate-heat-python27/4102 : SUCCESS in 2m 12s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34476/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/31435 : SUCCESS in 54m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34476/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31128 : SUCCESS in 56m 11s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34476/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/2766 : SUCCESS in 17m 21s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-12 05:02:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi guys, checking out the cloud-init code, it does appear that only the root 'user-data' can be gzipped (but this doesn't work with openstacks binary problem) and then only in the case when a url/file is included (via the text/x-include-url mime type, or via the equivalent header) will said file/url be fetched and gzip decompression will happen there. 

If its useful I can get that fixed to better handle this for your use-case.

Another option is to use the following.

- http://cloudinit.readthedocs.org/en/latest/topics/examples.html#writing-out-arbitrary-files

Use that mechanism for writing our your files (which can be gzipped and should go through the base64 encoding that yaml applies automatically) to '/var/lib/heat-cfntools' or '/var/lib/cloud' and '/var/lib/cloud/instance/scripts'. Then u can just pass in a yaml file, and let cloud-init do the write of your files (gzipped or not). THoughts?"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-12 12:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (3 inline comments)

Thanks Steve. That sucks that cloud-init doesn't handle it for us. I guess when they say "This list of rules is applied to each part of this multi-part file" (https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CloudInit) they mean "some subset of this list (try to guess which!)".

That said, it still seems better to me that we make the encoding/compression explicit and just decode it ourselves, rather than lie about the data type/encoding and hope that nothing adulterates the data on the way through.

At a minimum, I would suggest changing from "text/*; charset=utf-8" to "application/*". Since our subtypes are custom extensions ("x-cfninitdata" and "x-shellscript-c") anyhow, there's no real harm in just using e.g. "application/x-shellscript-c". Basically, this would just involve changing MIMEText to MIMEApplication and dropping the _charset parameter. The main effect of adding "_charset='utf-8'" to the MIMEText is to force it to be Base64 encoded, and MIMEApplication does that anyway.

An even more robust way would be to wrap the MIMEText subpart in an "application/x-gzip-compressed" subpart and do the parsing of the encapsulated MIME text document ourselves. I've put some example code inline that should do it (tested in the REPL, but not with cloud-init).

This is looking a lot tidier though, and ought to basically work.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-13 03:03:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Joshua,

I believe the reason we didn't use write files originally is cloudinit 0.69 didn't support that feature.  It does seem to make more sense to use that write method, but I'd rather refactor the part handler out of the code base in a different blueprint use-cloudinit-write"}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-13 03:11:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

Zane,

I'm a bit hesitant to implement the good review suggestions you have made given that h2 deadline is right around the corner and given that in h3, we should probably just use Joshua's suggestion for writing contents.  In the case Joshua points out, the entire part_handler.py code will disappear - imo no sense getting too wrapped around the axle making it perfect for h2 when I will just nuke this code entirely at the start of h3.

As is, the code is in pretty good shape to go in though, and would hate to see the feature miss the branch."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-13 03:29:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Sweet, I'll be out for a week, but I can try to make the cloud-init default behavior more what I think is expected (allow gzipping of all parts). That seems workable to me (although of course it depends on what versions of cloud-init you guys are trying to aim to support)."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-15 10:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

OK, that sounds reasonable. I would still prefer to do s/text/application/ for the types as I think that change is pretty low risk, and it looks like adding back the "with ..." syntax would also be pretty quick, but feel free to ignore the other inline comments.

Setting +1 so that I am not holding up the process :)'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:28:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Joshua,
I think we are going with LCD of what modern distros support - which I believe is 0.72.  The compression in the files section should work fine though and we can remove the part handler complexity entirely.

Perhaps when I get a chance I'll look at adding binary to the nova client libraries, although that looks like that involves oslo as well."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:30:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Zane,

I am travelling and unable to make the deadline unless this particular patch is +2ed.  Would you mind +2ing it?  At the start of h3 I'll add the files section as Joshua suggested first blueprint I tackle."}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-07-15 16:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-15 22:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This passes tempest instance tests.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-15 22:20:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I am really against rushing in things because of a deadline when they aren't intended to stay or be built on in the next milestone.

It sounds like there's a bit of a refactor planned for h3, and so rather than throwing this code in just to make h2, lets get the thing done right. I really like the idea of not needing part_handler.py and using cloud-config syntax for the whole thing. Lets explore that more before we just dump this excellent but still flawed code into h2."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

Going to rework this codebase in a different way to remove part-handler, so abandoning this review.  Thanks for the review time folks.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-20 14:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Ok, abandoned.

Anyway opened and fixing cloud-init.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-init/+bug/1203203'}]

commit_message:
Compress the userdata so more userdata can be passed

This code compresses most of the cloudinit metadata.  A new mime
type is introduced c-shellscript-c which is like x-shellscript but
compressed.  This allows the loguserdata.py shell script to be
compressed since it is large.  All of the existing x-cfninitdata
mime type is compressed before sending and decompressed in the
instance by the part handler.

blueprint gzip-userdata

Change-Id: Ifae6c676cd47cdf7fe9d297e322643c4b1b024fb

commit_message:
Add more robust gettext interpolation handling

While integrating the new delayed messaging gettextutils
functionality into Nova, there were issues with handling
the string interpolation operations. This change adds some
paths for dealing with these cases, such as non-deep-copyable
parameters, and python code-like objects. Also, adds some
much needed test coverage.

Change-Id: I65879875adf7a12fa0d1873167c2efadfc23a54b

Should it be single, double or triple still better than what we have now.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-07-18 12:29:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I know it's a tiny and perhaps annoying nit but, I agree with Doug, lets use triple-quoted strings here. I expect another commit in the future changing this with the above.

Also, the triple-quoted string will make it easier to modify this help text in the future, if needed."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-18 13:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

triple-quoting will add newlines to the string'}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-07-19 00:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What comes to mind immediately for this change, especially being a cosmetic change, is using """.

I think if you do the following it will actually work with triple-quotes and it won't include \n's. 

help_for_backdoor_port = \
"""line 1 \
line 2 \
line 3 \
...""""'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-19 01:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Configure for actually logging in to hosts

In tracking down people complaining that tempest didn't work, I
realized that we do not actually test ssh-ing in to the hosts we
create. Given how frequently this action fails on the public clouds,
perhaps we should test it.

Change-Id: Ibd8d675ef297a99e59bde41770d37f1dade8e746

subject: Fix support of multiple external networks in Quantum.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 1689, 'name': 'Robert Kukura', 'email': 'rk@theep.net', 'username': 'rkukura'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 6072, 'name': 'Eugene Nikanorov', 'email': 'enikanorov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'enikanorov'}, {'_account_id': 7073, 'name': 'mouad benchchaoui', 'email': 'm.benchchaoui@x-ion.de', 'username': 'mouad'}]

'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

In the above, replace "private networks" with "provider networks".'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm suggesting fixing l3-agent so that a single l3-agent can host multiple routers using different external networks, as long as external_network_bridge is unset (overriding the default of 'br-ex') and the external networks are proper provider networks (with the external flag set).

Given network namespace support and provider external networks, I see no fundamental reason a single l3-agent shouldn't be able to host multiple routers using different provider external networks. This seems a lot easier to manage that deploying multiple l3-agent process for this purpose."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Just to clarify, I believe the need to configure gateway_external_network_id came about because at the time the l3-agent was designed, provider networks were not yet available, so the external_network_bridge (of which there can only be one for a process) was introduced. 

The l3-agent works fine using a single provider external network with the following in l3_agent.ini:

external_network_bridge =

to override the default of 'br-ex'.

So my suggestion is to eliminate the need to configure gateway_external_network_id when their are multiple external networks."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Have you considered using a single l3-agent to support multiple routers with different external networks? This should be possible by setting external_network_bridge to empty (overriding default of 'br-ex'), creating the external networks as private networks, and using them as gateways for the routers."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree to Robert Kukura's advice."}, {'account_id': 7073, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7073, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Robert,

Thanks for your interset :)

As for your suggestion and if i understand you correctly you want to create the external networks as provider networks right ? but still if you flag this networks as router:external=True which you should if you want to set this networks as a router gateway (to let quantum deal with NATting ...), than quantum l3 agent will complain with the following "The 'gateway_external_network_id' must be configured if Quantum has more than one external network." and we are back to case 0 :)

But (And this is probably what you meant) if you want to just skip the quantum router completely and use the provider network to an existante physical network **where NATing must be already configured**, than IMHO this will not be as praticale as it should (comparing to nova-network), right ?

Thought ?'}, {'account_id': 7073, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Robert, Hi Yong, 

Thanks for the clarification, i understand what you mean, i will give it a try and see what i can come up with.

But as a side note, you know what will be great if we can create a new external network without having to restart the l3-agent or anything else, because as you may now restarting an l3-agent is not that simple as "restart ...", example in my company setup restarting an l3-agent take 30 minute to recover and this because we had to run the "quantum-ovs-cleanup" script if we wanted to make it work.

Thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fix support of multiple external networks in Quantum.

Allow quantum to have more than one l3-agent per host, and change AMPQ
communication between quantum-server and l3-agents to use broadcast
messaging instead of unicast.

fixes bug: #1191729

Change-Id: I6adec0af9a725d2292c2e409140fde49e5d66ae8

commit_message:
Implementation of Volume Affinity Weigher.

This weighter increases weight of a host that contains a volume
to be associated with an instance. Please note that this works
only if the driver used by cinder has a notion of host (for
example LVM driver). It also must be noted that currently
the weigher does not support multi-backend, however this may change
in future.

Change-Id: I52ad4de4726f007c14234d77b92979d4e101284f
BP: volume-affinity-weighter-function

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-12 17:14:35.000000000', 'message': 'Use PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE to skip .pyc files

Testing multiple python versions or multiple branches can cause
evil things to happen with leftover or old .pyc files. run_tests.sh
has been doing a find -delete on them before test runs, but tox
was not doing that. Turns out there is a consistent way to solve
the problem - just setting PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1 suppresses
the creation of the files in the first place.

Change-Id: I9b4a636094628e04f0f9ad13a1d762ba596575be
'}]
commit_message:
Use PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE to skip .pyc files

Testing multiple python versions or multiple branches can cause
evil things to happen with leftover or old .pyc files. run_tests.sh
has been doing a find -delete on them before test runs, but tox
was not doing that. Turns out there is a consistent way to solve
the problem - just setting PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1 suppresses
the creation of the files in the first place.

Change-Id: I9b4a636094628e04f0f9ad13a1d762ba596575be

commit_message:
Fix drift in deleted timestamp for Notification and Database

    The deleted timestamp for the usage event and the database
    were being set at different intervals.  Now the time is
    captured once and shared between both usages.

    If the server deletion times out, a log message will be
    recorded but it will not throw an exception.  Ensures
    completion of clean up and record of deletion

Fixes: bug 1201685

Change-Id: I66f52f8b8a3954989844d3b5fa0794913e94ddfa

commit_message:
Avoid refreshing firewall rules unnecessarily.

Adds a parameter to refresh_firewall allowing an array of ports to
be passed.  If an array is passed then the firewall will be refreshed
only for those ports.  If not passed, it will still refresh all
ports as it did before.

Change-Id: I539a135dbc3861e31cbb5c69cef0ff8c0f834527
Fixes: Bug #1202328

Having looked at your parallel-delete queue, this patch doesn't seem like it's really an improvement. Delete and Retain are _always_ valid policies, so why should we have to list them?

It looks like for the sake of avoiding one piece of similar-looking code in Resource (and we _do_ have options to refactor this) we're going to push the handling of the deletion policy into the plugins, resulting in many similar/identical bits of code."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-20 01:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Just to clarify, my parallel delete changeset was posted as a draft just in case some of it was useful for Vijendar.'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-18 20:31:43.000000000', 'message': 'Resources state explicitly their allowed delete policies.

Currently this is implicit based on whether the handle_snapshot_delete
method exists.

This is now brought in line with how resources indicate other
capabilities (update_allowed_keys, update_allowed_properties)

This is required to clean up the volume delete code paths for
blueprint parallel-delete

Change-Id: I8e93a2aa0256b61039e38ade773997db856194b4
'}]
commit_message:
Resources state explicitly their allowed delete policies.

Currently this is implicit based on whether the handle_snapshot_delete
method exists.

This is now brought in line with how resources indicate other
capabilities (update_allowed_keys, update_allowed_properties)

This is required to clean up the volume delete code paths for
blueprint parallel-delete

Change-Id: I8e93a2aa0256b61039e38ade773997db856194b4

subject: Handle instance objects in conductor compute_stop

Holy crap, this got majorly confused somehow. You should not be converting objects to their native/primitive format before sending them to something like compute_api.stop(). In fact, you should never be doing that in the first place. Does this even work?

I'm sure I answered a question on IRC incorrectly or something that got this all twisted, and for that I'm sorry, but...

From briefly re-looking at the bug traceback and what you have here, I think I'm confused about what you think is happening and what you need to do. Mark, thanks for looking at this critically. Unfortunately, this set has gotten really confused since its original inception. I'm really looking forward to being able to remove these conductor-wraps-db-nastiness pain points soon. I think a lot of the confusion comes in where it provides a versioned interface to something that is unversioned and usually client-side, which can change underneath without notice (kinda). Since most of these are used in periodic tasks, for which we have few real tests, the issues go unnoticed :("}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-07-08 18:36:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (5 inline comments)

commit_message:
Handle instance objects in conductor compute_stop

The compute manager is sending instance objects to
compute_stop in conductor but conductor's compute_stop
RPC proxy wasn't handling objects. This patch fixes that
and also handles compatibility with older installations
using the dict-style format in the conductor compute_stop
RPC proxy.

Fixes bug 1195849

Change-Id: Ib678df424a58a0d7023ce3b2bdd5001998daf398

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 21:53:27.000000000', 'message': "Close SQLite cursors when creating functions.

If the cursors are not closed, then when
create_function is called, if they are not
GC'd then create_function will fail. On Pythons
without reference counting (e.g. PyPy) they
will not be GC'd immediately.

Change-Id: I39210616d323691ccb745149f24430a7a61382ec
"}]
commit_message:
Close SQLite cursors when creating functions.

If the cursors are not closed, then when
create_function is called, if they are not
GC'd then create_function will fail. On Pythons
without reference counting (e.g. PyPy) they
will not be GC'd immediately.

Change-Id: I39210616d323691ccb745149f24430a7a61382ec

commit_message:
Use oslo.sphinx and remove local copy of doc theme

Use the new oslo.sphinx version of the OpenStack doc
theme instead of copying it into this repo.

blueprint oslo.sphinx

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: I0bd91f7bb43f97b99051fed65b75fc05d5149cc8

    volume attribute may be removed in cases where volume support is off

Fixes: bug 1200029

commit_message:
Add test for volume status check when extending

Ensure exception is raised if volume status is not 'available'
when extending volume.

Change-Id: I21337d5ca78090665b2feba50c74f853d3703650

commit_message:
Fixing NoneType issue with limit and offset

Fixes issue where the server returns 500 when the limit and/or offset in
paging are set to None.
- Adding tests for cleaning the paging parameters.

Fixes: bug #1202857
Change-Id: I769d44530be96ef18728b431acd1e198e8a84219

Thanks
Phil"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Phil,

In novaclient/client/novaclient.py line 68, the __init__ signature changed, from previously allowing the project_id keyword attribute to projectid:

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/02f906bcd6866b24fa0b48d47f573197b17f0753#L3L68'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-07-19 15:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think a revert is necessary.  You have a diagnosis of the problem"project_id" changed to "projectid"so it seems to me that the appropriate course of action is to change that to restore compatibility.  We generally want to reserve reverts to patches that significantly break compatibility or that seem to cause significant failures, and where the failure cannot easily be fixed.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-19 15:26:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks Kevin - I was just thinking the same.

commit_message:
Fix backwards-incompatible API change (method signature)

project_id was changed to projectid in a previous changeset.

Fixes bug 1203001

Change-Id: If9c21ae4f3cfbeb89569f6e4bd415c2041dc6294

commit_message:
Add an element that enables the SNMP daemon.

Installs and enables the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)
daemon. Adding this element will allow for more advanced external
monitoring of Nodes from applications like Nagios.

Change-Id: I77a746a4a5a5409e112e2ef48a100814c42b4868
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add aggregate commands

* Add aggregate: add host, create, delete, list, remove host, set, show

* Add list --long option
* Filter 'availability_zone' from the metadata fields
* Rename 'metadata' column to 'properties' in all output

Bug: 1172032
Blueprint: nova-client

Change-Id: Icd408c2b34af07f5102f53d3778d8546952a12c5

[{'created': '2013-07-17 07:44:37.000000000', 'message': "Select keystone endpoint url bases on SSL setting

When keystone is ssl enabled, (by setting ssl/enabled = TRUE in
keystone.conf) the keystone auth server is using HTTPS instead of HTTP
as the protocol. This patch generates the correct endpoint for the
keystone service calls.

In addition, if there is a defined 'admin_endpoint' in keystone.conf,
this setting will take precedence.

Change-Id: I23fe552808d8a959b0dff1c86989cf2aaa04582a
"}]
commit_message:
Select keystone endpoint url bases on SSL setting

When keystone is ssl enabled, (by setting ssl/enabled = TRUE in
keystone.conf) the keystone auth server is using HTTPS instead of HTTP
as the protocol. This patch generates the correct endpoint for the
keystone service calls.

In addition, if there is a defined 'admin_endpoint' in keystone.conf,
this setting will take precedence.

Change-Id: I23fe552808d8a959b0dff1c86989cf2aaa04582a

commit_message:
Add configurable log for storage server

This patch add configurable log for swift account/container/object
server service.
Partially implements blueprint puppet-swift-log-support.

Change-Id: Ib3db483dfbad97f23ab7ba2068632856b5e00f11

[{'created': '2013-07-19 15:01:49.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure dates are dates, not strings

In DB API we have a check which removes tzdata from dates, however
in some cases these dates are strings rather than datetime objects.
This will detect and correct these instances.

Fixes bug 1203069

Change-Id: I8ca955f6eb11e4b955ece9ec0822cda000b38f20
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dates are dates, not strings

In DB API we have a check which removes tzdata from dates, however
in some cases these dates are strings rather than datetime objects.
This will detect and correct these instances.

Fixes bug 1203069

Change-Id: I8ca955f6eb11e4b955ece9ec0822cda000b38f20

commit_message:
Update neutron-vpn-agent path

Fix path of vpn-agent as same as lbaas

- If q-vpn service is enabled, this patch switches the l3-agent to
vpn-agent

Change-Id: Ifbe3d51b5c89f759a71e904960c5f6cc99c44a5f

commit_message:
Add mysql support for ceilometer storage backend in devstack

Currently, devstack only support mongodb as ceilometer storage backend,
this patch is to add mysql storage support for ceilometer.
If you want to use mysql as backend during developing, you can specify
CEILOMETER_BACKEND=mysql in localrc file.
If you use mongodb, just ignore the parameter.

Change-Id: Ic2f475a9baa6d71a43cd29a6ca777ac972e47b0a
Implements: blueprint ceilometer-mysql-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-16 04:39:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use unique build dir for pip installs

There is a bug in pip [1] where it will choose to install a package
from an existing build-dir if it exists over the version actually
requested.

Thus if a prior component has installed a later version of the
package, the unpacked code is already in /tmp/$USER-pip-build; it gets
re-installed and manifests in a confusing error along the lines of

---
 Downloading/unpacking requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
   (from -r /home/stack//python-cinderclient/requirements.txt (line 5))
   Running setup.py egg_info for package requests
   Requested requests>=1.1,<1.2.3 (from -r
   /home/stack/python-cinderclient/requirements.txt (line 5)),
    but installing version 1.2.3
...
  error: Installed distribution requests 1.2.3 conflicts with
    requirement requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
---

I believe pip 1.4 fixes this problem, but it should always be safe to
specify a unique build-directory for pip installs to avoid picking up
old versions.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/709

Change-Id: I7ce919cddfd6d6175ae67bd864f82e256ebc7090
'}, {'created': '2013-07-16 06:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use unique build dir for pip installs

There is a bug in pip [1] where it will choose to install a package
from an existing build-dir if it exists over the version actually
requested.

Thus if a prior component has installed a later version of the
package, the unpacked code is already in /tmp/$USER-pip-build; it gets
re-installed and manifests in a confusing error along the lines of

---
 Downloading/unpacking requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
   (from -r /home/stack//python-cinderclient/requirements.txt (line 5))
   Running setup.py egg_info for package requests
   Requested requests>=1.1,<1.2.3 (from -r
   /home/stack/python-cinderclient/requirements.txt (line 5)),
    but installing version 1.2.3
...
  error: Installed distribution requests 1.2.3 conflicts with
    requirement requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
---

I believe pip 1.4 fixes this problem, but it should always be safe to
specify a unique build-directory for pip installs to avoid picking up
old versions.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/709

Change-Id: I7ce919cddfd6d6175ae67bd864f82e256ebc7090
'}, {'created': '2013-07-17 06:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use unique build dir for pip installs

commit_message:
Use unique build dir for pip installs

There is a bug in pip [1] where it will choose to install a package
from an existing build-dir if it exists over the version actually
requested.

Thus if a prior component has installed a later version of the
package, the unpacked code is already in /tmp/$USER-pip-build; it gets
re-installed and manifests in a confusing error along the lines of

---
 Downloading/unpacking requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
   (from -r /home/stack//python-cinderclient/requirements.txt (line 5))
   Running setup.py egg_info for package requests
   Requested requests>=1.1,<1.2.3 (from -r
   /home/stack/python-cinderclient/requirements.txt (line 5)),
    but installing version 1.2.3
...
  error: Installed distribution requests 1.2.3 conflicts with
    requirement requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
---

I believe pip 1.4 fixes this problem, but it should always be safe to
specify a unique build-directory for pip installs to avoid picking up
old versions.

We also add a cleanup_tmp function for clearing out anything that
stack.sh might leave around when un-stacking, and add a catch-all for
the pip-build dir.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/709

Change-Id: I7ce919cddfd6d6175ae67bd864f82e256ebc7090

commit_message:
Add quota commands

* Add quota set and quota show commands; these work on both
  the compute and volume APIs
* Add the --class variation on the above commands

Note: this replaces the existing volume-only quota commands and eliminates quota list

Blueprint: cinder-client
Bug: 1172064

Change-Id: I766d40e410e48f05e36e17e567a4f01a9411b40e

commit_message:
Add information about the Google style guide

Many of these checks came from the Google Style Guide, which has
excellent reasoning and background. Add links so that people can read
more about things that they may think are crazy.

Change-Id: I18f8250374ee3b2132ed56be21c7e3eecb60771d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 16:53:24.000000000', 'message': "docs(usage): lay out a vision for client usage

This change introduces a single document, docs/usage.rst.

The rationale is to define how operating marconi-client might look
like. With a clear enough definition, the public interfaces should
be easy to implement.

It's a lightweight spec that's easy to update.

Change-Id: Iaec9b5701ab61166daeabc45ec12c576c8723d9c
"}, {'created': '2013-07-11 22:14:26.000000000', 'message': 'docs(README): add link to design wiki.

Makes it easier to access primary design document for client dev.

Change-Id: Iaec9b5701ab61166daeabc45ec12c576c8723d9c
'}]
commit_message:
docs(README): add link to design wiki.

Makes it easier to access primary design document for client dev.

Change-Id: Iaec9b5701ab61166daeabc45ec12c576c8723d9c

commit_message:
Fix Message Tests

This fixes the message tests, to use href for GETs & DELETEs of a
single message. This patch also removes the test dependency on
/usr/share/dict/words being present.

Change-Id: I8537a585eaf4a836fa080a4caf9c3560f37f693d

commit_message:
Use heat-cfntools path hint for cfn.metadata_url

Heat passes this in via cloud-init to assist heat-cfntools in finding the
cfn metadata server url. This will likely be the primary location used,
and cfn.metadata_url will be an override.

Also doing some cleanup, removed unused cfn.EC2_METADATA_URL and
reordered and regrouped imports.

Change-Id: I52093bdd8a4b939ae06cf483535ed5d5a0e273d4

commit_message:
Run forever if a command is configured

This makes os-collect-config stay resident and prepares it for a more
event based operation when the Heat API is ready for that via longpoll
or callbacks or something else.

Change-Id: Ic91f2201d504e9f8e0ada6d34a7d6d94785aec87

commit_message:
Support repo names with multiple '-'s

The search and replace that converted dashes in REPONAME only converted
the first dash. They should all be converted.

Change-Id: I76a48cf5bdfa8664f0a65d0238fa4da7d80305db

We could also have a decorator that logs INs and OUTs of this methods but we won't be able to tell it which args should be printed - positional ones - but, since those are debug messages, we could just print everything. Production environments shouldn't be using debug level.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2013-07-19 19:22:08.000000000', 'message': "Set work-dir to cached repository

source-repositories does a git reset on the .git directory of cached
repositories. But doesn't specify the directory to reset. A working
directory needs to be specified so that the $PWD isn't used.

Without this change $PWD is polluted with the contents of repositories
being cached.

Change-Id: Ic37b702ac579bf766bb2204a988fa9468d308abf
"}]
commit_message:
Set work-dir to cached repository

source-repositories does a git reset on the .git directory of cached
repositories. But doesn't specify the directory to reset. A working
directory needs to be specified so that the $PWD isn't used.

Without this change $PWD is polluted with the contents of repositories
being cached.

Change-Id: Ic37b702ac579bf766bb2204a988fa9468d308abf

[{'created': '2013-07-18 21:03:34.000000000', 'message': 'Grab testr logs even when testr fails.

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh:
Do all testr log processing when we deal with the other logs. Do not
depend on other scripts/functions being called to do this. Downstream
scripts may exit prematurely resulting in a loss of data.

* devstack-vm-gate.sh:
Stop processing testr logs here.

Change-Id: I24144e32f9ba7b279aaec0d3fadcfdf3bc5ef77c
'}]
commit_message:
Grab testr logs even when testr fails.

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh:
Do all testr log processing when we deal with the other logs. Do not
depend on other scripts/functions being called to do this. Downstream
scripts may exit prematurely resulting in a loss of data.

* devstack-vm-gate.sh:
Stop processing testr logs here.

Change-Id: I24144e32f9ba7b279aaec0d3fadcfdf3bc5ef77c

commit_message:
Added developer documentation for Trove

Added initial sphinx/docutils documentation for Trove. Also made
corresponding changes to setup.cfg so that OpenStack CI is able
to build the Trove developer docs.

Fixes blueprint: trove-dev-docs

Change-Id: I900ffd2c0b661fb7642fa06c08ee92892eb176f0

commit_message:
Remove Unnecessary mysql::server Dependency

Previously, the db::mysql class required mysql::server.  This is
unnecessary since the mysql::db define requires the mysql::config
class for db creattion.  Additionally, this prevents users from
using a different class such as galera::server to manage
the database.

Change-Id: Ifb0fa261f9f5921cf9fe5b309decceab608d4726

commit_message:
Remove Unnecessary mysql::server Dependency

Previously, the db::mysql class required mysql::server.  This is
unnecessary since the mysql::db define requires the mysql::config
class for db creattion.  Additionally, this prevents users from
using a different class such as galera::server to manage
the database.

Change-Id: Ief246d868bcee0f6d1eabd873ad90dac56aa1ee6

commit_message:
Remove Unnecessary mysql::server Dependency

Previously, the db::mysql class required mysql::server.  This is
unnecessary since the mysql::db define requires the mysql::config
class for db creattion.  Additionally, this prevents users from
using a different class such as galera::server to manage
the database.

Change-Id: I8ee9303eef67657dd2898d910897748a0af5415b

"}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-19 00:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I went ahead and double checked that everything should work as expected:

* when a mysql::server class is declared, is specified a dependency between itself and mysql::config
https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/server.pp#L32

* mysql::db already declares the config as a dependency, so through the transitive property of resources, it also depends on mysql::server
* the other resource in the class, cinder::db::mysql::host_access, only contains resources database_user and database_grant which both depend on the database resource created in mysql::db.

I double checked that the mysql::server and mysql::config classes did not contain any classes (so they do not suffer from class containment issues)'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-19 00:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Clone_image should return dict of vol properties, clone status.

The method will work fine in case of drivers not dependent
on volume properties like provider_location. It will fail to
restart in case of nfs drivers and also leave volume created as
result of clone_image functionality created in the
nfs share in dangling state after deletion as provider_location
is None. This fix requires dict of volume properties, cloned status
to be returned which facilitates passing back provider_location
in case of nfs drivers and hence resolves the issue.

bug 1200708

Change-Id: I590571e52d1c64b6dba7d7e76cd71badd74e51d1

commit_message:
Make Storwize/SVC tests work without simulator.

Moved to using brick to get connector info and fixed a small bug to get
tests working on real storage again. Also fixed up simulator to handle
the multihostmap case properly.

Change-Id: I7f5804aa94eac29d8c3cec0f8e9ae9339d4e0816

'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(43 inline comments)

A couple comments on style. There are places where you use the following: 

Ex. 
LOG.info(_("Some log message %s"), variable)

Which will work but I don't *think* the injection will actually take place until it is written to the log and if logging level is set to something other than 'info' the inject won't ever happen. 

I would suggest settling on this instead: 

LOG.info(_("Some log message %s") % variable)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-07-16 22:58:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Lance, I'm not sure why that would be a problem.  We don't want to waste cycles doing string formatting for a log message that won't ever get used, so having it done in the log function instead of beforehand seems like a good thing to me."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-17 01:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ldbragst,

We are using the , operator instead of % because that is the way logging was meant to be used.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-17 04:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-17 04:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-17 04:07:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Lance, there was no reason to duplicate the same comment for every changed line. I you thought that it's all is incorrect you could leave single general comment otherwise it appears to be a waste of reviewing cycle.

commit_message:
Send updated aggregate to compute on add/rm host

The XenAPI driver relies on getting an up-to-date version of the
aggregate during add_host_to_aggregate and remove_host_from_aggregate
This change ensures that happens.

Fixes bug 1161619
Change-Id: I764e1fc3b9ff20b6eda8f6ec00849f2164de0a49

commit_message:
Update pip depend to >= 1.0

Precise ships with 1.0 by default. Until we force everyone on to
1.4, there is no need to express a depend here which is not true.

Change-Id: Id4101fa4fd1c60a6ffef6bef3dcd03522e681231

commit_message:
Update capitalization on all of our requirements

Although pip does the right thing, there are various proxies and whatnot
that actually can get confused with the case-insensitivity.

Moving forward, we should try to make sure we put things in the files
correctly.

Change-Id: I6eb5eb8a3d11dd009f94f02da32cf9580ac7333a

commit_message:
Allow hacking 0.6.x

We have just released hacking 0.6, this change will allow people to use
it.  Hacking 0.6 introduces several new checks, but each project has a
similar pinning so changing this won't break anything.

Change-Id: I2189e008fc6ffa8f6787070e0ee78dcdcda5586b

compatibility, so we want to enable it elsewhere as soon
as possible.

1. Add DocImpact to the follow-up patch, commenting that cells may now be configured through a file and that a transport URL should be used in the file and what that transport URL looks like.

2. Add logging to the downgrade case in the migration, should we not be able to parse a cell's transport URL during the downgrade, to warn the admin that the cell is effectively disabled.

3. Add nullable=False to the transport_url column in both the models and the migration.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-14 22:17:08.000000000', 'message': 'Convert cells to use a transport URL

Cells currently keeps all inter-cell communication data, including
usernames and passwords, in individual columns in the "cells" table
of the database.  This renders it difficult to specify alternate
transports (e.g., 0mq).  Work is currently in progress to add the
concept of "transport URLs," but the end goal is to remove this data
from the database entirely and store it in a configuration file.

This change adds transport URLs to cells in a very limited fashion;
only AMQP URLs are recognized, and no auxiliary data is recognized.
This cleans up the database table, and will make it easier to move
cell data out of the database and into the configuration file.

Partially implements blueprint eliminate-clear-passwords-from-cells-table.

WIP; still to do:

* Implement database migration
* Write appropriate migration test

commit_message:
Convert cells to use a transport URL

Cells currently keeps all inter-cell communication data, including
usernames and passwords, in individual columns in the "cells" table
of the database.  This renders it difficult to specify alternate
transports (e.g., 0mq).  Work is currently in progress to add the
concept of "transport URLs," but the end goal is to remove this data
from the database entirely and store it in a configuration file.

This change adds transport URLs to cells in a very limited fashion;
only rabbit and qpid URLs are recognized, and no auxiliary data is
recognized.  This cleans up the database table, and will make it
easier to move cell data out of the database and into the
configuration file.

Partially implements blueprint eliminate-clear-passwords-from-cells-table.

DocImpact: None.  Transport URLs are not exposed to deployers in
           this patch.

Change-Id: I6b18f7643ab694f5ff34206b80865c40b1ec2680

whitebox tests don't run in the gate, so I don't want to drop a test until those are made to work in the gate. I'd rather get to the bottom of why this is flakey."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-06-19 10:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good point Sean, thanks.

The test is flaky by nature. It tries to create an image of a server while the server is in deleting. There's no way you can ensure that the server does not complete its delete before the image create is started.

On gate this test seems to be stable, but when running against a real cloud it is flaky. So I agree we can keep this parked until white-box tests are part of the gate."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-04 15:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This type of testing should be part of the nova projects unit tests.
The nova unit tests are able to use a sqlite database.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-07-05 15:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I don't think that test belongs in a functional test suite at all.. it's a unit test. There's simply no way to guanrantee that the delete of the image does not complete before the call to get the image is made -- unless you use some sort of dependency injection or fake -- which is the purview of unit tests.

I vote to remove it.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-07-11 07:50:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The same discussion applies to test_create_image_when_server_is_rebooting.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-11 17:20:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 15:10:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update postfix element per install instructions.

Updates postfix element to reload instead of restart. This is called
for in the installation instructions. This also fixes a issue with
the postfix element where the current restart can fail and cause ORC
post-install scripts with higher numbers to not run.

Change-Id: I853a2f2890fcc0b006fcfc214fb1ca900d03613a
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update postfix element per install instructions.

Updates postfix element to reload instead of restart. This is called
for in the installation instructions. This also fixes a issue with
the postfix element where the current restart can fail and cause ORC
post-install scripts with higher numbers to not run.

Change-Id: I853a2f2890fcc0b006fcfc214fb1ca900d03613a
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 13:54:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove list comprehension where the result is unused.

Using a list comprehension here makes the code less
readable, and is also slower (since it has to allocate
and grow a list that is unused).

Change-Id: I74cc9d2cf2e271a2c45d45cc5ea777189c02eacb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove list comprehension where the result is unused.

Using a list comprehension here makes the code less
readable, and is also slower (since it has to allocate
and grow a list that is unused).

Change-Id: I74cc9d2cf2e271a2c45d45cc5ea777189c02eacb

commit_message:
Remove unneeded class filter from .testr.conf

This commit removes the unnecessary class filter run_test_classes.py
and reverts the .testr.conf to the standard format. The class filter
is not needed when using test grouping.

Change-Id: I460c48121c26d07eb29f355c07a2059f5e6b24b0

commit_message:
Revert hardening of Storwize/SVC SSH commands.

This reverts commit 6be79a8e3b4607adbbe6a26ee565156cd0fb36b0.
Paramiko expects string commands, not lists.

Change-Id: I1b762c0311a0ac810427ea033f737fd067761b1c

commit_message:
stop using + \ in help string

Hacking specifies 'Long lines should be wrapped in parentheses
in preference to using a backslash for line continuation.' Was
noticed when merging this into nova. It's a minor cleanup, but
good to be consistent.

This keeps the old formatting of no newlines, though if newlines
were fine a docstring might also be appropriate.

Change-Id: I8adccdc8bf82f7b97dbbc8969d6b9de4be31e214

subject: Multiple dispatcher enablment - use pipeline
messages:
[{'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-06-27 19:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

still working on it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 19:54:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/34783/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/2996 : FAILURE in 1m 17s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34783/1/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/1801/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34783/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/2929 : FAILURE in 19m 17s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34783/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/2926 : FAILURE in 4m 31s
"}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-06-28 02:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-28 03:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/34783/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3001 : SUCCESS in 1m 11s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34783/2/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/1806/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 31s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34783/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/2934 : SUCCESS in 19m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34783/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/2931 : SUCCESS in 4m 17s
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 07:48:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

There's something really weird with the implementation as you did it. The thing is that you are adding a new workflow which is for example:

notification -> ceilometer-collector -> rpc_publisher -> ceilometer-collector -> another-publisher

I barely see the point of this there. Why someone would re-publisher after receiving on the collector? That doesn't make any sense to me."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 08:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Though I meant to add, I like the file publisher idea, you could split it out of it and send it in another patch, that one should be merged I guess.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-06-28 13:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

Julien, this is to add the capability that no matter how the
meters got into database (pollerster, notification, etc) will
be given a chance to be handled by a publisher. Right now,
there is no way to do that easily. That is also the point of
blueprint. One can certainly add a publisher in the pipeline
to direct the meter to some outlet, but the meters coming
from pollerster or central agent will be missed. This is to
amend that.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-06-28 13:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

in a different implementation, I basically had a different
path, like this.
  notification -> ceilometer-collector -> publisher(s)

But Doug wanted this to be implemented using pipeline, I
think this is what it will end up.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:25:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Julien, this is to add the capability that no matter how the meters got into database (pollerster, notification, etc) will be given a chance to be handled by a publisher.

This is wrong. The standard way to publish a Counter is via a publisher, and therefore via a pipeline. The case you describe doesn't exist if you are using Ceilometer.

> Right now, there is no way to do that easily. That is also the point of blueprint. One can certainly add a publisher in the pipeline to direct the meter to some outlet, but the meters coming from pollerster or central agent will be missed. This is to amend that.

To me the point of the blueprint is the ability to overload the collector with new behaviour. Re-publishing counter could be one of it, but doing it that way just seems wrong at first glance."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

What you say about having:
  notification -> ceilometer-collector -> publisher(s)

Is already what we have actually. You are transforming this to:
  notification -> ceilometer-collector -> publisher(s) -> ceilometer-collector -> publishers right now, with a possibility of infinite loop'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Julien,
  OK, how will you suggest to do this? The requirement is that
we want all the meter data not only going into database but
also possibly other outlets, not limited to 1 or 2, should be
based on configuration. In the other implementation, I split
it at the collector, but Doug wanted to use pipeline. So if
you can point to me where the pipeline can be inserted, that
will be quite nice. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:53:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Could you define what your outlet is like?

If it's for example a file like the publisher you wrote here, there's no need to do anything more than write a correct pipeline.yaml to publish your counters to this 'outlet'."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Julien, the outlet can be another database, text message
generators, emails, so that the meter data will be feed into
these outlet and eventually metering data can be massaged
the way each publisher wants, then publish to where they
would like to. In our case, we simply want to have a hook
which is configurable to allow apps to be plugged in. I will try the pipeline and see how it works.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:13:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Ok, so this definitively the wrong design, and I think you had misunderstand how the current pipeline works. I hope it's clearer now."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-02 12:56:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

looks like I'm confused by the point of the publisher model too then."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-02 13:37:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (5 inline comments)

@Julien - The purpose of this patch is to allow the collector service to use pipelines so that it can still be used as the central processing location for the data. Is your objection that it doesn't need to be, because each producer of data can have its pipeline configured to do that processing already?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-02 13:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Doug: yes, that's my main objection. This adds a lot of burden to the collector.

It adds potentially things like infinite looping (collector publishing and receiving over RPC over and over again).

I can understand the need to have a central collecting point that records in things like a database and listen over the RPC, that's why we built the collector in the first place :). Adding an extension on top of it (I think that's what the first patch did) makes sense to me too, but this seems wrong."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-02 14:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Julien - OK, I didn't like the first patch because it reproduced some, but not all, of the features of the pipeline.

Perhaps we should have a discussion about the blueprint for this on the mailing list."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

other implementation got in.'}]
revisions:

'}, {'created': '2013-06-28 02:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'Multiple dispatcher enablment - use pipeline

Ceilometer does not allow multiple outlets for metering data.
With this implementation, one can use multiple pipelines to process
metering data, a meter can be saved into a database and other

commit_message:
Multiple dispatcher enablment - use pipeline

Ceilometer does not allow multiple outlets for metering data.
With this implementation, one can use multiple pipelines to process
metering data, a meter can be saved into a database and other
systems based on publishers used in the configuration.

blueprint multi-dispatcher-enablement

Change-Id: Ifaf49a07ba27e35a3a6dc03b92a61526973f2afd

commit_message:
Restructure hypervisor section

This patch splits xen out into intro, configure and install,
in preparation for our documentation restructure.

Existing guides are modified so they aren't adversely affected.
patchset 2 - diane fleming - made editorial changes/spellcheck/formatting

Change-Id: I914e3ab50f0cf55016a5b3b5b81f80cc95cb9eac
bp:restructure-documentation

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 09:50:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix interface-list got none mac address.

novaclient expect the response json body has a column 'mac_address', but
actually is 'mac_addr'. This patch is a quick fix. Just print out
"mac_addr" is readable enough.

Fix bug: #1199706

Change-Id: I68823a3d719ee2f5d9d8b6227ca8eb858fc270c3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix interface-list got none mac address.

novaclient expect the response json body has a column 'mac_address', but
actually is 'mac_addr'. This patch is a quick fix. Just print out
"mac_addr" is readable enough.

Fix bug: #1199706

Change-Id: I68823a3d719ee2f5d9d8b6227ca8eb858fc270c3

- http://logs.openstack.org/37380/2/check/gate-requirements-install/268 : SUCCESS in 14m 45s

Hi,

Please don't be so restrictive with == requirements. See here:

http://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=python-ldap&searchon=names&suite=all&section=all

Debian has python-ldap 2.4.10, and you are asking for ==2.3.13. This way, Debian will never be able to satisfy your dependency."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 03:17:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add python-ldap to requirements

python-ldap provides an object-oriented API to access LDAP directory servers
from Python programs. Mainly it wraps the OpenLDAP 2.x libs for that purpose.
The ldap module is used in Nova and Keystone.

Change-Id: I9de754941f11e6adbb8ef4a18d0ea300d9d95dcc
'}, {'created': '2013-07-17 03:21:45.000000000', 'message': 'Move python-ldap to requirements

The ldap module is used in Nova and Keystone. Both projects use ldap
on their services not tests

Change-Id: I9de754941f11e6adbb8ef4a18d0ea300d9d95dcc
'}]
commit_message:
Move python-ldap to requirements

The ldap module is used in Nova and Keystone. Both projects use ldap
on their services not tests

Change-Id: I9de754941f11e6adbb8ef4a18d0ea300d9d95dcc

Comments inline. I think the try: block is wider than necessary.

Also, I'm not sure suppressing the error is the right thing, but I'm not sure that it's the wrong thing either. I think there are potentially other situations where the scheduler might get InstanceNotFound here. For instance, what if the Nova DB is an HA pair, one fails, and the instance creation hadn't propagated to the other? I would expect the scheduler to log a meaningful error here."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-11 16:18:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think the DB HA situation needs to be addressed at a lower layer that the exception handler I'm adding as its a very generic situation not limited to the scheduler.

This patch is just repeating the pattern already established in the compute manager for deletion during an in-flight operation.

I'll spin a new version with the exception block reduced in scope as suggested"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-12 10:49:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 11:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Handle instance being deleted while in filter scheduler

Adds handling of InstanceNotFound when trying to update the
scheduled_at time of an instance.

Users can delete an instance at any time (and many test
cases delete very quickly), so this should be a warning
not an error

Fixes bug 1191126

Change-Id: I72b296668f60b1de71ff8c6d7bbb749023d89f12

commit_message:
Sync models with migrations.

There are a lot of difference in models and actual db state
from migrations.
This patch fixes:
- wrong type of column,
- wrong length of column,
- missing indexes,
- extra indexes,
- errors.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I709b588f0e545e1921d75473f1dc25b75045a8fa

Fixes: bug #1202784

commit_message:
Prevent an array index exception if server does not have an image.

Change-Id: I63d3a92cea4da042942540b0800b5c4e825983c5
Fixes: bug #1202784

subject: Make servers::update() use Instance.save() to do the work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-30 16:12:27.000000000', 'message': "Make servers::update() use Instance.save() to do the work

This makes the update() api call operate on the instance object
directly, by calling update() and save(), instead of calling into
compute_api to do the work.

This requires an extension to a previous kludge for api_samples
to make sure that the database gets updated in sync with the
values we're stubbing out for network information.

This also requires a tweak to one of the tests to return an
updated fake instance object directly from the database, instead
of just from the compute_api.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I62b4009ef97ea47b20442a149ba172de4e343e15

This requires an extension to a previous kludge for api_samples
to make sure that the database gets updated in sync with the
values we're stubbing out for network information.

This also requires a tweak to one of the tests to return an
updated fake instance object directly from the database, instead
of just from the compute_api.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

commit_message:
Make servers::update() use Instance.save() to do the work

This makes the update() api call operate on the instance object
directly, by calling update() and save(), instead of calling into
compute_api to do the work.

This requires an extension to a previous kludge for api_samples
to make sure that the database gets updated in sync with the
values we're stubbing out for network information.

This also requires a tweak to one of the tests to return an
updated fake instance object directly from the database, instead
of just from the compute_api.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I62b4009ef97ea47b20442a149ba172de4e343e15

subject: Make Instance.save() handle cells DB updates

changes to the instance.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I228bc3e0288ca94fd30b91eaf1bc5b77bcdc249f
'}, {'created': '2013-07-05 23:27:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make Instance.save() to handle cells DB updates

changes to the instance.

temporary necessity as we transition to doing all updates via
Instance.save().

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

commit_message:
Make Instance.save() handle cells DB updates

This adds support to Instance.save() to handle updating cells with
changes to the instance.

Instance.save() needs to support expected_vm_state when saving changes.
It also needs to understand whether or not any task_state/vm_state
changes are coming from a forced-reset.  Normally we do not want to
update child cells' view of vm_state and task_state, but forced-resets
should be sent down.

Adds a new cells method for updating instances in child cells.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I228bc3e0288ca94fd30b91eaf1bc5b77bcdc249f

subject: Convert suspend/resume to use objects

commit_message:
Convert suspend/resume to use objects

Switch suspend/resume to use objects.  This also converts the compute
API tests to be unit tests.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I256e495b214742f28d21ca9d779716f32c56f9bc

subject: Raise exceptions when Spice/VNC are unavailable
messages:
[{'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:27:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The code looks good thanks.
Do we really need the config option?
We could put the onus on users to just disable vnc if they don't want fallback to it?

Did you mean to chmod manager.py in this change?"}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:34:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd honestly be happy to pull the option out because it sensible behavior in my opinion.  I just can't imagine a user making a console request for Spice, getting back nothing then deciding nothing is better than VNC.

The chmod wasn't intentional, I'll fix that up, cheers."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-20 00:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-06-20 01:16:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-20 01:33:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work
